2590  return false;
2591  }
2592 
2593  if( has_floor( up_p ) && !up_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_DOWN ) &&
2594  !up_is_ledge && !via_ramp ) {
2595  // Can't move from up to down
2596  if( std::abs( from.x - to.x ) == 1 || std::abs( from.y - to.y ) == 1 ) {
2597  // Break the move into two - vertical then horizontal
2598  tripoint midpoint( down_p.xy(), up_p.z );
2599  return valid_move( down_p, midpoint, bash, flying, via_ramp ) &&
2600  valid_move( midpoint, up_p, bash, flying, via_ramp );
2601  }
2602  return false;
2603  }
2604 
2605  if( !flying && !down_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GOES_UP ) &&
2606  !down_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE ) &&
2607  !down_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP ) &&
2608  !up_is_ledge && !via_ramp ) {
2609  // Can't safely reach the lower tile
2610  return false;
2611  }
2612 
2613  if( bash ) {
2614  return true;
2615  }
2616 
2617  int part_up;
2618  const vehicle *veh_up = veh_at_internal( up_p, part_up );
2619  if( veh_up != nullptr ) {
2620  // TODO: Hatches below the vehicle, passable frames
2621  return false;
2622  }
2623 
2624  int part_down;
2625  const vehicle *veh_down = veh_at_internal( down_p, part_down );
2626  if( veh_down != nullptr && veh_down->roof_at_part( part_down ) >= 0 ) {
2627  // TODO: OPEN (and only open) hatches from above
2628  return false;
2629  }
2630 
2631  // Currently only furniture can block movement if everything else is OK
2632  // TODO: Vehicles with boards in the given spot
2633  return up.get_furn_t().movecost >= 0;
2634 }
2635 
2636 // End of move cost
2637 
2638 double map::ranged_target_size( const tripoint &p ) const
2639 {
2640  if( impassable( p ) ) {
2641  return 1.0;
2642  }
2643 
2644  if( !has_floor( p ) ) {
2645  return 0.0;
2646  }
2647 
2648  // TODO: Handle cases like shrubs, trees, furniture, sandbags...
2649  return 0.1;
2650 }
2651 
2652 int map::climb_difficulty( const tripoint &p ) const
2653 {
2654  if( p.z > OVERMAP_HEIGHT || p.z < -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
2655  debugmsg( "climb_difficulty on out of bounds point: %d, %d, %d", p.x, p.y, p.z );
2656  return INT_MAX;
2657  }
2658 
2659  int best_difficulty = INT_MAX;
2660  int blocks_movement = 0;
2661  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LADDER, p ) ) {
2662  // Really easy, but you have to stand on the tile
2663  return 1;
2664  } else if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP, p ) ||
2665  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_UP, p ) ||
2666  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, p ) ) {
2667  // We're on something stair-like, so halfway there already
2668  best_difficulty = 7;
2669  }
2670 
2671  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( p, 1 ) ) {
2672  if( impassable_ter_furn( pt ) ) {
2673  // TODO: Non-hardcoded climbability
2674  best_difficulty = std::min( best_difficulty, 10 );
2675  blocks_movement++;
2676  } else if( veh_at( pt ) ) {
2677  // Vehicle tiles are quite good for climbing
2678  // TODO: Penalize spiked parts?
2679  best_difficulty = std::min( best_difficulty, 7 );
2680  }
2681 
2682  if( best_difficulty > 5 && has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CLIMBABLE, pt ) ) {
2683  best_difficulty = 5;
2684  }
2685  }
2686 
2687  // TODO: Make this more sensible - check opposite sides, not just movement blocker count
2688  return std::max( 0, best_difficulty - blocks_movement );
2689 }
2690 
2691 bool map::has_floor( const tripoint &p ) const
2692 {
2693  if( !zlevels || p.z < -OVERMAP_DEPTH + 1 || p.z > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
2694  return true;
2695  }
2696  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
2697  return true;
2698  }
2699  return !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) &&
2700  !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR_WATER, p );
2701 }
2702 
2703 bool map::has_floor_or_water( const tripoint &p ) const
2704 {
2705  if( !zlevels || p.z < -OVERMAP_DEPTH + 1 || p.z > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
2706  return true;
2707  }
2708  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
2709  return true;
2710  }
2711  return !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p );
2712 }
2713 
2714 bool map::supports_above( const tripoint &p ) const
2715 {
2716  const const_maptile tile = maptile_at( p );
2717  const ter_t &ter = tile.get_ter_t();
2718  if( ter.movecost == 0 ) {
2719  return true;
2720  }
2721 
2722  const furn_id frn_id = tile.get_furn();
2723  if( frn_id != furn_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
2724  const furn_t &frn = frn_id.obj();
2725  if( frn.movecost < 0 ) {
2726  return true;
2727  }
2728  }
2729 
2730  return veh_at( p ).has_value();
2731 }
2732 
2733 bool map::has_floor_or_support( const tripoint &p ) const
2734 {
2735  const tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
2736  return !valid_move( p, below, false, true );
2737 }
2738 
2739 bool map::has_vehicle_floor( const tripoint &p ) const
2740 {
2741  const tripoint_bub_ms p_bub( p );
2742  return has_vehicle_floor( p_bub );
2743 }
2744 bool map::has_vehicle_floor( const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
2745 {
2746  return veh_at( p ).part_with_feature( "BOARDABLE", false ) ||
2747  veh_at( p ).part_with_feature( "OBSTACLE", false );
2748 }
2749 
2750 void map::drop_everything( const tripoint &p )
2751 {
2752  if( has_floor_or_water( p ) ) {
2753  return;
2754  }
2755 
2756  drop_furniture( p );
2757  drop_items( p );
2758  drop_vehicle( p );
2759  drop_fields( p );
2760 }
2761 
2762 void map::drop_furniture( const tripoint &p )
2763 {
2764  const furn_id frn = furn( p );
2765  if( frn == furn_str_id::NULL_ID() || frn->has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLOATS_IN_AIR ) ) {
2766  return;
2767  }
2768 
2769  enum support_state {
2770  SS_NO_SUPPORT = 0,
2771  SS_BAD_SUPPORT, // TODO: Implement bad, shaky support
2772  SS_GOOD_SUPPORT,
2773  SS_FLOOR, // Like good support, but bash floor instead of tile below
2774  SS_CREATURE
2775  };
2776 
2777  // Checks if the tile:
2778  // has floor (supports unconditionally)
2779  // has support below
2780  // has unsupporting furniture below (bad support, things should "slide" if possible)
2781  // has no support and thus allows things to fall through
2782  const auto check_tile = [this]( const tripoint & pt ) {
2783  if( has_floor_or_water( pt ) ) {
2784  return SS_FLOOR;
2785  }
2786 
2787  tripoint below_dest( pt.xy(), pt.z - 1 );
2788  if( supports_above( below_dest ) ) {
2789  return SS_GOOD_SUPPORT;
2790  }
2791 
2792  const furn_id frn_id = furn( below_dest );
2793  if( frn_id != furn_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
2794  const furn_t &frn = frn_id.obj();
2795  // Allow crushing tiny/nocollide furniture
2796  if( !frn.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_TINY ) &&
2797  !frn.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NOCOLLIDE ) ) {
2798  return SS_BAD_SUPPORT;
2799  }
2800  }
2801 
2802  if( get_creature_tracker().creature_at( below_dest ) != nullptr ) {
2803  // Smash a critter
2804  return SS_CREATURE;
2805  }
2806 
2807  return SS_NO_SUPPORT;
2808  };
2809 
2810  tripoint current( p.xy(), p.z + 1 );
2811  support_state last_state = SS_NO_SUPPORT;
2812  while( last_state == SS_NO_SUPPORT ) {
2813  current.z--;
2814  // Check current tile
2815  last_state = check_tile( current );
2816  }
2817 
2818  if( current == p ) {
2819  // Nothing happened
2820  if( last_state != SS_FLOOR ) {
2821  support_dirty( current );
2822  }
2823 
2824  return;
2825  }
2826 
2827  furn_set( p, furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
2828  furn_set( current, frn );
2829 
2830  // If it's sealed, we need to drop items with it
2831  const furn_t &frn_obj = frn.obj();
2832  if( frn_obj.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEALED ) && has_items( p ) ) {
2833  map_stack old_items = i_at( p );
2834  map_stack new_items = i_at( current );
2835  for( const item &it : old_items ) {
2836  new_items.insert( it );
2837  }
2838 
2839  i_clear( p );
2840  }
2841 
2842  // Approximate weight/"bulkiness" based on strength to drag
2843  int weight;
2844  if( frn_obj.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_TINY ) ||
2845  frn_obj.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NOCOLLIDE ) ) {
2846  weight = 5;
2847  } else {
2848  weight = frn_obj.is_movable() ? frn_obj.move_str_req : 20;
2849  }
2850 
2851  if( frn_obj.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_ROUGH ) ||
2852  frn_obj.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SHARP ) ) {
2853  weight += 5;
2854  }
2855 
2856  // TODO: Balance this.
2857  int dmg = weight * ( p.z - current.z );
2858 
2859  if( last_state == SS_FLOOR ) {
2860  // Bash the same tile twice - once for furniture, once for the floor
2861  bash( current, dmg, false, false, true );
2862  bash( current, dmg, false, false, true );
2863  } else if( last_state == SS_BAD_SUPPORT || last_state == SS_GOOD_SUPPORT ) {
2864  bash( current, dmg, false, false, false );
2865  tripoint below( current.xy(), current.z - 1 );
2866  bash( below, dmg, false, false, false );
2867  } else if( last_state == SS_CREATURE ) {
2868  const std::string &furn_name = frn_obj.name();
2869  bash( current, dmg, false, false, false );
2870  tripoint below( current.xy(), current.z - 1 );
2871  Creature *critter = get_creature_tracker().creature_at( below );
2872  if( critter == nullptr ) {
2873  debugmsg( "drop_furniture couldn't find creature at %d,%d,%d",
2874  below.x, below.y, below.z );
2875  return;
2876  }
2877 
2878  critter->add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "Falling %s hits you!" ),
2879  _( "Falling %s hits <npcname>" ),
2880  furn_name );
2881  // TODO: A chance to dodge/uncanny dodge
2882  Character *pl = critter->as_character();
2883  monster *mon = critter->as_monster();
2884  if( pl != nullptr ) {
2885  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
2886  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 3, dmg ),
2887  0, 0.5f ) );
2888  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "head" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 3, dmg ),
2889  0, 0.5f ) );
2890  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "leg_l" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 2, dmg ),
2891  0, 0.4f ) );
2892  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "leg_r" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 2, dmg ),
2893  0, 0.4f ) );
2894  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "arm_l" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 2, dmg ),
2895  0, 0.4f ) );
2896  pl->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "arm_r" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( dmg / 2, dmg ),
2897  0, 0.4f ) );
2898  } else if( mon != nullptr ) {
2899  // TODO: Monster's armor and size - don't crush hulks with chairs
2900  mon->apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), rng( dmg, dmg * 2 ) );
2901  }
2902  }
2903 
2904  // Re-queue for another check, in case bash destroyed something
2905  support_dirty( current );
2906 }
2907 
2908 void map::drop_items( const tripoint &p )
2909 {
2910  if( !has_items( p ) ) {
2911  return;
2912  }
2913 
2914  map_stack items = i_at( p );
2915  // TODO: Make items check the volume tile below can accept
2916  // rather than disappearing if it would be overloaded
2917 
2918  tripoint below( p );
2919  int max_height_fallen = 0;
2920  while( !has_floor_or_water( below ) ) {
2921  below.z--;
2922  max_height_fallen++;
2923  }
2924 
2925  if( below == p ) {
2926  return;
2927  }
2928 
2929  float damage_total = 0.0f;
2930  for( item &i : items ) {
2931  units::mass wt_dropped = i.weight();
2932 
2933  if( max_height_fallen <= 0 ) {
2934  debugmsg( "Tried to calculate damage for falling item, but item somehow fell less than one z-level!" );
2935  max_height_fallen = 1;
2936  }
2937  Creature *creature_below = get_creature_tracker().creature_at( below );
2938  double height_fallen = max_height_fallen;
2939  if( creature_below ) {
2940  // Discount most of the first z-level's falling distance, depending on how big the creature is
2941  // Characters (player/NPC) are normally medium, which is 0.5 or standing about 1.2m tall.
2942  // This is shorter than the average adult, but it's an *okay* approximation.
2943  height_fallen -= occupied_tile_fraction( creature_below->get_size() );
2944  }
2945  // in meters, assuming one z-level is ~2.5m.
2946  const double distance_to_fall = height_fallen * 2.5;
2947 
2948  // in meters per second (squared).
2949  const double gravity_acceleration_constant = 9.8;
2950 
2951  // in seconds.
2952  double falling_time = sqrt( 2 * distance_to_fall / gravity_acceleration_constant );
2953 
2954  // in meters per second.
2955  double velocity_at_impact = gravity_acceleration_constant * falling_time;
2956 
2957  // in joules.
2958  double impact_energy = to_kilogram( wt_dropped ) * std::pow( velocity_at_impact, 2.0 ) / 2.0;
2959 
2960  // in faces smashed (parts per hundred).
2961  double damage = sqrt( impact_energy );
2962  damage_total += damage;
2963 
2964  add_item_or_charges( below, i );
2965 
2966  // Bash creature standing below
2967  if( creature_below ) {
2968  // creature's dodge modifier
2969  float dodge_mod = creature_below->dodge_roll();
2970 
2971  // Most of the threat comes from the projectile going very fast before it enters a creature's vertical FOV
2972  // or e.g. it fell from so high up that there was no indication of something coming down before it (possibly) hits
2973  float hit_mod = velocity_at_impact / ( dodge_mod + 5 );
2974 
2975  int creature_hit_chance = rng( 0, 100 );
2976  double avoid_chance = hit_mod * occupied_tile_fraction( creature_below->get_size() );
2977  // We use sqrt here because it trends back towards 1. Spectacularly low hit_mod will still have SOME chance to hit while
2978  // hits of >1 avoid_chance are not always going to strike the head
2979  creature_hit_chance /= sqrt( avoid_chance );
2980  bodypart_id hit_part;
2981  if( creature_hit_chance < 15 ) {
2982  hit_part = creature_below->get_random_body_part_of_type( body_part_type::type::head );
2983  } else if( creature_hit_chance < 30 ) {
2984  hit_part = creature_below->get_random_body_part_of_type( body_part_type::type::torso );
2985  } else if( creature_hit_chance < 90 ) {
2986  hit_part = creature_below->get_random_body_part_of_type( body_part_type::type::arm );
2987  } else if( creature_hit_chance < 100 ) {
2988  hit_part = creature_below->get_random_body_part_of_type( body_part_type::type::leg );
2989  } else {
2990  add_msg_if_player_sees( creature_below->pos(), _( "Falling %1$s misses %2$s!" ), i.tname(),
2991  creature_below->disp_name() );
2992  }
2993  // Did we hit at all? Then run the message.
2994  if( creature_hit_chance < 100 ) {
2995  if( hit_part.is_valid() && !creature_below->is_monster() ) {
2996  //~First positional argument: Item name. Second: Name of a person (e.g. "Jane") or player (e.g. "you"). Third: Body part name, accusative.
2997  const std::string msg = _( "Falling %1$s hits %2$s on the %3$s for %4$i damage!" );
2998  add_msg_if_player_sees( creature_below->pos(), msg,
2999  i.tname(), creature_below->disp_name(), hit_part->accusative, static_cast<int>( damage ) );
3000  } else {
3001  add_msg_if_player_sees( creature_below->pos(), _( "Falling %1$s hits %2$s for %3$i damage!" ),
3002  i.tname(), creature_below->disp_name(), static_cast<int>( damage ) );
3003  }
3004  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage type!
3005  creature_below->deal_damage( nullptr, hit_part, damage_instance( damage_bash, damage ) );
3006  }
3007  }
3008 
3009  // Bash items at bottom since currently bash_items only bash glass items
3010  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage type!
3011  int chance = static_cast<int>( 200 * i.resist( damage_bash, true ) / damage + 1 );
3012  if( one_in( chance ) ) {
3013  i.inc_damage();
3014  }
3015  }
3016 
3017  // Bash terain, furniture and vehicles on tile below
3018  bash( below, damage_total / 2 );
3019  i_clear( p );
3020 }
3021 
3022 void map::drop_vehicle( const tripoint &p )
3023 {
3024  const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p );
3025  if( !vp ) {
3026  return;
3027  }
3028  vp->vehicle().is_falling = true;
3029  set_seen_cache_dirty( p );
3030 }
3031 
3032 void map::drop_fields( const tripoint &p )
3033 {
3034  field &fld = field_at( p );
3035  if( fld.field_count() == 0 ) {
3036  return;
3037  }
3038 
3039  const tripoint below = p + tripoint_below;
3040  for( const auto &iter : fld ) {
3041  const field_entry &entry = iter.second;
3042  // For now only drop cosmetic fields, which don't warrant per-turn check
3043  // Active fields "drop themselves"
3044  if( entry.get_field_type()->accelerated_decay ) {
3045  add_field( below, entry.get_field_type(), entry.get_field_intensity(), entry.get_field_age() );
3046  remove_field( p, entry.get_field_type() );
3047  }
3048  }
3049 }
3050 
3051 void map::support_dirty( const tripoint &p )
3052 {
3053  if( zlevels ) {
3054  support_cache_dirty.insert( p );
3055  }
3056 }
3057 
3058 void map::process_falling()
3059 {
3060  if( !zlevels ) {
3061  support_cache_dirty.clear();
3062  return;
3063  }
3064 
3065  if( !support_cache_dirty.empty() ) {
3066  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MAP, "Checking %d tiles for falling objects",
3067  support_cache_dirty.size() );
3068  // We want the cache to stay constant, but falling can change it
3069  std::set<tripoint> last_cache = std::move( support_cache_dirty );
3070  support_cache_dirty.clear();
3071  for( const tripoint &p : last_cache ) {
3072  drop_everything( p );
3073  }
3074  }
3075 }
3076 
3077 bool map::has_flag( const std::string &flag, const tripoint &p ) const
3078 {
3079  return has_flag_ter_or_furn( flag, p ); // Does bound checking
3080 }
3081 
3082 bool map::has_flag( const std::string &flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3083 {
3084  return has_flag_ter_or_furn( flag, p.raw() ); // Does bound checking
3085 }
3086 
3087 bool map::can_put_items( const tripoint &p ) const
3088 {
3089  return can_put_items_ter_furn( p ) || veh_at( p ).cargo().has_value();
3090 }
3091 
3092 bool map::can_put_items( const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3093 {
3094  return can_put_items( p.raw() );
3095 }
3096 
3097 bool map::can_put_items_ter_furn( const tripoint &p ) const
3098 {
3099  return !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NOITEM, p ) && !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEALED, p );
3100 }
3101 
3102 bool map::can_put_items_ter_furn( const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3103 {
3104  return can_put_items_ter_furn( p.raw() );
3105 }
3106

3108 {
3109  return ter( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3110 }
3111

3113 {
3114  return furn( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3115 }
3116 
3117 bool map::has_flag_furn( const std::string &flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3118 {
3119  return furn( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3120 }
3121 
3122 bool map::has_flag_ter_or_furn( const std::string &flag, const tripoint &p ) const
3123 {
3124  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3125  return false;
3126  }
3127 
3128  point l;
3129  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
3130  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
3131  debugmsg( "Tried to process terrain at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
3132  return false;
3133  }
3134 
3135  return current_submap->get_ter( l ).obj().has_flag( flag ) ||
3136  current_submap->get_furn( l ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3137 }
3138 
3139 bool map::has_flag( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint &p ) const
3140 {
3141  return has_flag_ter_or_furn( flag, p ); // Does bound checking
3142 }
3143 
3144 bool map::has_flag( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3145 {
3146  return has_flag( flag, p.raw() );
3147 }
3148 
3149 bool map::has_flag_ter( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint &p ) const
3150 {
3151  return ter( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3152 }
3153 
3154 bool map::has_flag_ter( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3155 {
3156  return ter( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3157 }
3158

3160 {
3161  return furn( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3162 }

3164 bool map::has_flag_furn( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3165 {
3166  return furn( p ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3167 }
3168 
3169 bool map::has_flag_ter_or_furn( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint &p ) const
3170 {
3171  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3172  return false;
3173  }
3174 
3175  point l;
3176  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
3177  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
3178  debugmsg( "Tried to process terrain at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
3179  return false;
3180  }
3181 
3182  return current_submap->get_ter( l ).obj().has_flag( flag ) ||
3183  current_submap->get_furn( l ).obj().has_flag( flag );
3184 }
3185 
3186 bool map::has_flag_ter_or_furn( const ter_furn_flag flag, const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
3187 {
3188  return has_flag_ter_or_furn( flag, p.raw() );
3189 }
3190 
3191 // End of 3D flags
3192 
3193 // Bashable - common function
3194 
3195 int map::bash_rating_internal( const int str, const furn_t &furniture,
3196  const ter_t &terrain, const bool allow_floor,
3197  const vehicle *veh, const int part ) const
3198 {
3199  bool furn_smash = false;
3200  bool ter_smash = false;
3201  ///\EFFECT_STR determines what furniture can be smashed
3202  if( furniture.id && furniture.bash.str_max != -1 ) {
3203  furn_smash = true;
3204  ///\EFFECT_STR determines what terrain can be smashed
3205  } else if( terrain.bash.str_max != -1 && ( !terrain.bash.bash_below || allow_floor ) ) {
3206  ter_smash = true;
3207  }
3208 
3209  if( veh != nullptr && vpart_position( const_cast<vehicle &>( *veh ), part ).obstacle_at_part() ) {
3210  // Monsters only care about rating > 0, NPCs should want to path around cars instead
3211  return 2; // Should probably be a function of part hp (+armor on tile)
3212  }
3213 
3214  int bash_min = 0;
3215  int bash_max = 0;
3216  if( furn_smash ) {
3217  bash_min = furniture.bash.str_min;
3218  bash_max = furniture.bash.str_max;
3219  } else if( ter_smash ) {
3220  bash_min = terrain.bash.str_min;
3221  bash_max = terrain.bash.str_max;
3222  } else {
3223  return -1;
3224  }
3225 
3226  ///\EFFECT_STR increases smashing damage
3227  if( str < bash_min ) {
3228  return 0;
3229  } else if( str >= bash_max ) {
3230  return 10;
3231  }
3232 
3233  int ret = ( 10 * ( str - bash_min ) ) / ( bash_max - bash_min );
3234  // Round up to 1, so that desperate NPCs can try to bash down walls
3235  return std::max( ret, 1 );
3236 }
3237 
3238 // 3D bashable
3239 
3240 bool map::is_bashable( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3241 {
3242  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3243  DebugLog( D_WARNING, D_MAP ) << "Looking for out-of-bounds is_bashable at "
3244  << p.x << ", " << p.y << ", " << p.z;
3245  return false;
3246  }
3247 
3248  if( veh_at( p ).obstacle_at_part() ) {
3249  return true;
3250  }
3251 
3252  if( has_furn( p ) && furn( p ).obj().bash.str_max != -1 ) {
3253  return true;
3254  }
3255 
3256  const map_bash_info &ter_bash = ter( p ).obj().bash;
3257  return ter_bash.str_max != -1 && ( !ter_bash.bash_below || allow_floor );
3258 }
3259 
3260 bool map::is_bashable_ter( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3261 {
3262  const map_bash_info &ter_bash = ter( p ).obj().bash;
3263  return ter_bash.str_max != -1 && ( !ter_bash.bash_below || allow_floor );
3264 }
3265 
3266 bool map::is_bashable_furn( const tripoint &p ) const
3267 {
3268  return has_furn( p ) && furn( p ).obj().bash.str_max != -1;
3269 }
3270 
3271 bool map::is_bashable_ter_furn( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3272 {
3273  return is_bashable_furn( p ) || is_bashable_ter( p, allow_floor );
3274 }
3275 
3276 int map::bash_strength( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3277 {
3278  if( has_furn( p ) && furn( p ).obj().bash.str_max != -1 ) {
3279  return furn( p ).obj().bash.str_max;
3280  }
3281 
3282  const map_bash_info &ter_bash = ter( p ).obj().bash;
3283  if( ter_bash.str_max != -1 && ( !ter_bash.bash_below || allow_floor ) ) {
3284  return ter_bash.str_max;
3285  }
3286 
3287  return -1;
3288 }
3289 
3290 int map::bash_resistance( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3291 {
3292  if( has_furn( p ) && furn( p ).obj().bash.str_min != -1 ) {
3293  return furn( p ).obj().bash.str_min;
3294  }
3295 
3296  const map_bash_info &ter_bash = ter( p ).obj().bash;
3297  if( ter_bash.str_min != -1 && ( !ter_bash.bash_below || allow_floor ) ) {
3298  return ter_bash.str_min;
3299  }
3300 
3301  return -1;
3302 }
3303 
3304 int map::bash_rating( const int str, const tripoint &p, const bool allow_floor ) const
3305 {
3306  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3307  DebugLog( D_WARNING, D_MAP ) << "Looking for out-of-bounds is_bashable at "
3308  << p.x << ", " << p.y << ", " << p.z;
3309  return -1;
3310  }
3311 
3312  if( str <= 0 ) {
3313  return -1;
3314  }
3315 
3316  const furn_t &furniture = furn( p ).obj();
3317  const ter_t &terrain = ter( p ).obj();
3318  const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p );
3319  vehicle *const veh = vp ? &vp->vehicle() : nullptr;
3320  const int part = vp ? vp->part_index() : -1;
3321  return bash_rating_internal( str, furniture, terrain, allow_floor, veh, part );
3322 }
3323 
3324 // End of 3D bashable
3325 
3326 void map::make_rubble( const tripoint &p, const furn_id &rubble_type, const bool items,
3327  const ter_id &floor_type, bool overwrite )
3328 {
3329  if( overwrite ) {
3330  ter_set( p, floor_type );
3331  furn_set( p, rubble_type );
3332  } else {
3333  // First see if there is existing furniture to destroy
3334  if( is_bashable_furn( p ) ) {
3335  destroy_furn( p, true );
3336  }
3337  // Leave the terrain alone unless it interferes with furniture placement
3338  if( impassable( p ) && is_bashable_ter( p ) ) {
3339  destroy( p, true );
3340  }
3341  // Check again for new terrain after potential destruction
3342  if( impassable( p ) ) {
3343  ter_set( p, floor_type );
3344  }
3345 
3346  if( !is_open_air( p ) ) {
3347  furn_set( p, rubble_type );
3348  }
3349  }
3350 
3351  if( !items || is_open_air( p ) ) {
3352  return;
3353  }
3354 
3355  //Still hardcoded, but a step up from the old stuff due to being in only one place
3356  if( rubble_type == furn_f_wreckage ) {
3357  item chunk( "steel_chunk", calendar::turn );
3358  item scrap( "scrap", calendar::turn );
3359  add_item_or_charges( p, chunk );
3360  add_item_or_charges( p, scrap );
3361  if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
3362  item pipe( "pipe", calendar::turn );
3363  item wire( "wire", calendar::turn );
3364  add_item_or_charges( p, pipe );
3365  add_item_or_charges( p, wire );
3366  }
3367  } else if( rubble_type == furn_f_rubble_rock ) {
3368  item rock( "rock", calendar::turn );
3369  int rock_count = rng( 1, 3 );
3370  for( int i = 0; i < rock_count; i++ ) {
3371  add_item_or_charges( p, rock );
3372  }
3373  } else if( rubble_type == furn_f_rubble ) {
3374  item splinter( "splinter", calendar::turn );
3375  int splinter_count = rng( 2, 8 );
3376  for( int i = 0; i < splinter_count; i++ ) {
3377  add_item_or_charges( p, splinter );
3378  }
3379  spawn_item( p, itype_nail, 1, rng( 20, 50 ) );
3380  }
3381 }
3382 
3383 bool map::is_water_shallow_current( const tripoint &p ) const
3384 {
3385  return has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CURRENT, p ) &&
3386  !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, p );
3387 }
3388 
3389 bool map::is_divable( const tripoint &p ) const
3390 {
3391  return has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, p ) &&
3392  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, p );
3393 }
3394 
3395 bool map::is_outside( const tripoint &p ) const
3396 {
3397  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3398  return true;
3399  }
3400 
3401  const auto &outside_cache = get_cache_ref( p.z ).outside_cache;
3402  return outside_cache[p.x][p.y];
3403 }
3404 
3405 bool map::is_last_ter_wall( const bool no_furn, const point &p,
3406  const point &max, const direction dir ) const
3407 {
3408  point mov;
3409  switch( dir ) {
3410  case direction::NORTH:
3411  mov.y = -1;
3412  break;
3413  case direction::SOUTH:
3414  mov.y = 1;
3415  break;
3416  case direction::WEST:
3417  mov.x = -1;
3418  break;
3419  case direction::EAST:
3420  mov.x = 1;
3421  break;
3422  default:
3423  break;
3424  }
3425  point p2( p );
3426  bool result = true;
3427  bool loop = true;
3428  while( loop && ( ( dir == direction::NORTH && p2.y >= 0 ) ||
3429  ( dir == direction::SOUTH && p2.y < max.y ) ||
3430  ( dir == direction::WEST && p2.x >= 0 ) ||
3431  ( dir == direction::EAST && p2.x < max.x ) ) ) {
3432  if( no_furn && has_furn( p2 ) ) {
3433  loop = false;
3434  result = false;
3435  } else if( !has_flag_ter( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAT, p2 ) ) {
3436  loop = false;
3437  if( !has_flag_ter( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, p2 ) ) {
3438  result = false;
3439  }
3440  }
3441  p2.x += mov.x;
3442  p2.y += mov.y;
3443  }
3444  return result;
3445 }
3446 
3447 bool map::tinder_at( const tripoint &p )
3448 {
3449  for( const item &i : i_at( p ) ) {
3450  if( i.has_flag( flag_TINDER ) ) {
3451  return true;
3452  }
3453  }
3454  return false;
3455 }
3456 
3457 bool map::flammable_items_at( const tripoint &p, int threshold )
3458 {
3459  if( !has_items( p ) ||
3460  ( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEALED, p ) &&
3461  !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_ALLOW_FIELD_EFFECT, p ) ) ) {
3462  // Sealed containers don't allow fire, so shouldn't allow setting the fire either
3463  return false;
3464  }
3465 
3466  for( const item &i : i_at( p ) ) {
3467  if( i.flammable( threshold ) ) {
3468  return true;
3469  }
3470  }
3471 
3472  return false;
3473 }
3474 
3475 bool map::flammable_items_at( const tripoint_bub_ms &p, int threshold )
3476 {
3477  return flammable_items_at( p.raw(), threshold );
3478 }
3479 
3480 bool map::is_flammable( const tripoint &p )
3481 {
3482 
3483  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE, p ) ) {
3484  return true;
3485  }
3486 
3487  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE_ASH, p ) ) {
3488  return true;
3489  }
3490 
3491  if( get_field_intensity( p, fd_web ) > 0 ) {
3492  return true;
3493  }
3494 
3495  if( flammable_items_at( p ) ) {
3496  return true;
3497  }
3498 
3499  return false;
3500 }
3501 
3502 bool map::is_flammable( const tripoint_bub_ms &p )
3503 {
3504  return is_flammable( p.raw() );
3505 }
3506 
3507 void map::decay_fields_and_scent( const time_duration &amount )
3508 {
3509  // TODO: Make this happen on all z-levels
3510 
3511  // Decay scent separately, so that later we can use field count to skip empty submaps
3512  get_scent().decay();
3513 
3514  // Coordinate code copied from lightmap calculations
3515  // TODO: Z
3516  const int smz = abs_sub.z();
3517  const auto &outside_cache = get_cache_ref( smz ).outside_cache;
3518  for( int smx = 0; smx < my_MAPSIZE; ++smx ) {
3519  for( int smy = 0; smy < my_MAPSIZE; ++smy ) {
3520  submap *cur_submap = get_submap_at_grid( { smx, smy, smz } );
3521  if( cur_submap == nullptr ) {
3522  debugmsg( "Tried to process field at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", smx, smy, smz );
3523  continue;
3524  }
3525  int to_proc = cur_submap->field_count;
3526  if( to_proc < 1 ) {
3527  if( to_proc < 0 ) {
3528  cur_submap->field_count = 0;
3529  dbg( D_ERROR ) << "map::decay_fields_and_scent: submap at "
3530  << ( abs_sub + point( smx, smy ) ).to_string()
3531  << "has " << to_proc << " field_count";
3532  }
3533  get_cache( smz ).field_cache.reset( smx + ( smy * MAPSIZE ) );
3534  // This submap has no fields
3535  continue;
3536  }
3537 
3538  for( int sx = 0; sx < SEEX; ++sx ) {
3539  if( to_proc < 1 ) {
3540  // This submap had some fields, but all got proc'd already
3541  break;
3542  }
3543 
3544  for( int sy = 0; sy < SEEY; ++sy ) {
3545  const point p( sx + smx * SEEX, sy + smy * SEEY );
3546 
3547  const field &fields = cur_submap->get_field( { sx, sy} );
3548  if( !outside_cache[p.x][p.y] ) {
3549  to_proc -= fields.field_count();
3550  continue;
3551  }
3552 
3553  for( const auto &fp : fields ) {
3554  to_proc--;
3555  field_entry cur = fp.second;
3556  const field_type_id type = cur.get_field_type();
3557  const int decay_amount_factor = type.obj().decay_amount_factor;
3558  if( decay_amount_factor != 0 ) {
3559  const time_duration decay_amount = amount / decay_amount_factor;
3560  cur.set_field_age( cur.get_field_age() + decay_amount );
3561  }
3562  }
3563  }
3564  }
3565 
3566  if( to_proc > 0 ) {
3567  cur_submap->field_count = cur_submap->field_count - to_proc;
3568  dbg( D_ERROR ) << "map::decay_fields_and_scent: submap at "
3569  << abs_sub.to_string()
3570  << "has " << cur_submap->field_count - to_proc << "fields, but "
3571  << cur_submap->field_count << " field_count";
3572  }
3573  }
3574  }
3575 }
3576 
3577 point map::random_outdoor_tile() const
3578 {
3579  std::vector<point> options;
3580  for( const tripoint &p : points_on_zlevel() ) {
3581  if( is_outside( p.xy() ) ) {
3582  options.push_back( p.xy() );
3583  }
3584  }
3585  return random_entry( options, point_north_west );
3586 }
3587 
3588 bool map::has_adjacent_furniture_with( const tripoint &p,
3589  const std::function<bool( const furn_t & )> &filter ) const
3590 {
3591  for( const tripoint &adj : points_in_radius( p, 1 ) ) {
3592  if( has_furn( adj ) && filter( furn( adj ).obj() ) ) {
3593  return true;
3594  }
3595  }
3596 
3597  return false;
3598 }
3599 
3600 bool map::has_nearby_fire( const tripoint &p, int radius ) const
3601 {
3602  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( p, radius ) ) {
3603  if( has_field_at( pt, fd_fire ) ) {
3604  return true;
3605  }
3606  if( has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_USABLE_FIRE, p ) ) {
3607  return true;
3608  }
3609  }
3610  return false;
3611 }
3612 
3613 bool map::has_nearby_table( const tripoint_bub_ms &p, int radius ) const
3614 {
3615  for( const tripoint_bub_ms &pt : points_in_radius( p, radius ) ) {
3616  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAT_SURF, pt ) ) {
3617  return true;
3618  }
3619  const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( pt );
3620  if( vp && vp->part_with_feature( "FLAT_SURF", true ) ) {
3621  return true;
3622  }
3623  }
3624  return false;
3625 }
3626 
3627 bool map::has_nearby_chair( const tripoint &p, int radius ) const
3628 {
3629  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( p, radius ) ) {
3630  const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( pt );
3631  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_CAN_SIT, pt ) ) {
3632  return true;
3633  }
3634  if( vp && vp->vehicle().has_part( "SEAT" ) ) {
3635  return true;
3636  }
3637  }
3638  return false;
3639 }
3640 
3641 bool map::has_nearby_ter( const tripoint &p, const ter_id &type, int radius ) const
3642 {
3643  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( p, radius ) ) {
3644  if( ter( pt ) == type ) {
3645  return true;
3646  }
3647  }
3648  return false;
3649 }
3650 
3651 bool map::terrain_moppable( const tripoint_bub_ms &p )
3652 {
3653  // Moppable items ( spills )
3654  if( !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUIDCONT, p ) ) {
3655  map_stack items = i_at( p );
3656  auto found = std::find_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
3657  return it.made_of( phase_id::LIQUID );
3658  } );
3659 
3660  if( found != items.end() ) {
3661  return true;
3662  }
3663  }
3664 
3665  // Moppable fields ( blood )
3666  for( const std::pair<const field_type_id, field_entry> &pr : field_at( p ) ) {
3667  if( pr.second.get_field_type().obj().phase == phase_id::LIQUID ) {
3668  return true;
3669  }
3670  }
3671 
3672  // Moppable vehicles ( blood splatter )
3673  if( const optional_vpart_position ovp = veh_at( p ) ) {
3674  vehicle *const veh = &ovp->vehicle();
3675  for( const int elem : veh->parts_at_relative( ovp->mount(), true ) ) {
3676  const vehicle_part &vp = veh->part( elem );
3677  if( vp.blood > 0 ) {
3678  return true;
3679  }
3680 
3681  const vehicle_stack items = veh->get_items( vp );
3682  auto found = std::find_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
3683  return it.made_of( phase_id::LIQUID );
3684  } );
3685 
3686  if( found != items.end() ) {
3687  return true;
3688  }
3689  }
3690  }
3691 
3692  return false;
3693 }
3694 
3695 bool map::mop_spills( const tripoint_bub_ms &p )
3696 {
3697  bool retval = false;
3698 
3699  if( !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUIDCONT, p ) ) {
3700  map_stack items = i_at( p );
3701  auto new_end = std::remove_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
3702  return it.made_of( phase_id::LIQUID );
3703  } );
3704  retval = new_end != items.end();
3705  while( new_end != items.end() ) {
3706  new_end = items.erase( new_end );
3707  }
3708  }
3709 
3710  field &fld = field_at( p );
3711  for( const auto &it : fld ) {
3712  if( it.first->phase == phase_id::LIQUID ) {
3713  remove_field( p, it.first );
3714  retval = true;
3715  }
3716  }
3717 
3718  if( const optional_vpart_position ovp = veh_at( p ) ) {
3719  vehicle *const veh = &ovp->vehicle();
3720  for( const int elem : veh->parts_at_relative( ovp->mount(), true ) ) {
3721  vehicle_part &vp = veh->part( elem );
3722  if( vp.blood > 0 ) {
3723  vp.blood = 0;
3724  retval = true;
3725  }
3726  //remove any liquids that somehow didn't fall through to the ground
3727  vehicle_stack here = veh->get_items( vp );
3728  auto new_end = std::remove_if( here.begin(), here.end(), []( const item & it ) {
3729  return it.made_of( phase_id::LIQUID );
3730  } );
3731  retval |= ( new_end != here.end() );
3732  while( new_end != here.end() ) {
3733  new_end = here.erase( new_end );
3734  }
3735  }
3736  } // if veh != 0
3737  return retval;
3738 }
3739 
3740 int map::collapse_check( const tripoint &p ) const
3741 {
3742  const bool collapses = has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_COLLAPSES, p );
3743  const bool supports_roof = has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, p );
3744 
3745  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SINGLE_SUPPORT, p ) ) {
3746  // We should definitely collapse if there's no support below, and
3747  // given that a single wall as a support below isn't sufficient, a tree
3748  // is deemed not to be sufficient either.
3749  return 0;
3750  }
3751 
3752  int num_supports = p.z == OVERMAP_DEPTH ? 0 : -5;
3753  // if there's support below, things are less likely to collapse
3754  if( p.z > -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
3755  const tripoint &pbelow = tripoint( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
3756  for( const tripoint &tbelow : points_in_radius( pbelow, 1 ) ) {
3757  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, tbelow ) ) {
3758  num_supports += 1;
3759  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, tbelow ) ) {
3760  num_supports += 2;
3761  }
3762  if( tbelow == pbelow ) {
3763  num_supports += 2;
3764  }
3765  }
3766  }
3767  }
3768 
3769  for( const tripoint &t : points_in_radius( p, 1 ) ) {
3770  if( p == t ) {
3771  continue;
3772  }
3773 
3774  if( collapses ) {
3775  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_COLLAPSES, t ) ) {
3776  num_supports++;
3777  } else if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, t ) ) {
3778  num_supports += 2;
3779  }
3780  } else if( supports_roof ) {
3781  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, t ) ) {
3782  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, t ) ) {
3783  num_supports += 4;
3784  } else if( !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_COLLAPSES, t ) ) {
3785  num_supports += 3;
3786  }
3787  }
3788  }
3789  }
3790 
3791  return 1.7 * num_supports;
3792 }
3793 
3794 // there is still some odd behavior here and there and you can get floating chunks of
3795 // unsupported floor, but this is much better than it used to be
3796 void map::collapse_at( const tripoint &p, const bool silent, const bool was_supporting,
3797  const bool destroy_pos )
3798 {
3799  const bool supports = was_supporting || has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, p );
3800  const bool wall = was_supporting || has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, p );
3801  // don't bash again if the caller already bashed here
3802  if( destroy_pos ) {
3803  destroy( p, silent );
3804  crush( p );
3805  make_rubble( p );
3806  }
3807  const bool still_supports = has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, p );
3808 
3809  // If something supporting the roof collapsed, see what else collapses
3810  if( supports && !still_supports ) {
3811  for( const tripoint &t : points_in_radius( p, 1 ) ) {
3812  // If z-levels are off, tz == t, so we end up skipping a lot of stuff to avoid bugs.
3813  const tripoint &tz = tripoint( t.xy(), t.z + 1 );
3814  // if nothing above us had the chance of collapsing, move on
3815  if( !one_in( collapse_check( tz ) ) ) {
3816  continue;
3817  }
3818  // if a wall collapses, walls without support from below risk collapsing and
3819  //propagate the collapse upwards
3820  if( zlevels && wall && p == t && has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, tz ) ) {
3821  collapse_at( tz, silent );
3822  }
3823  // floors without support from below risk collapsing into open air and can propagate
3824  // the collapse horizontally but not vertically
3825  if( p != t && ( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, t ) &&
3826  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_COLLAPSES, t ) ) ) {
3827  collapse_at( t, silent );
3828  }
3829  // this tile used to support a roof, now it doesn't, which means there is only
3830  // open air above us
3831  if( zlevels ) {
3832  // ensure that the layer below this one is not a wall, otherwise you have a ledge dropping onto
3833  // a wall which doesn't make sense.
3834  if( !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_WALL, t ) ) {
3835  furn_set( tz, furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
3836  ter_set( tz, ter_t_open_air );
3837  Creature *critter = get_creature_tracker().creature_at( tz );
3838  if( critter != nullptr ) {
3839  creature_on_trap( *critter );
3840  }
3841  }
3842  }
3843  }
3844  }
3845  // it would be great to check if collapsing ceilings smashed through the floor, but
3846  // that's not handled for now
3847 }
3848 
3849 void map::smash_items( const tripoint &p, const int power, const std::string &cause_message )
3850 {
3851  if( !has_items( p ) || has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_PLANT, p ) ) {
3852  return;
3853  }
3854 
3855  // Keep track of how many items have been damaged, and what the first one is
3856  bool item_was_damaged = false;
3857  int items_damaged = 0;
3858  int items_destroyed = 0;
3859  std::string damaged_item_name;
3860 
3861  std::vector<item> contents;
3862  map_stack items = i_at( p );
3863  for( auto i = items.begin(); i != items.end(); ) {
3864  if( i->made_of( phase_id::LIQUID ) ) {
3865  i++;
3866  continue;
3867  }
3868  if( i->active ) {
3869  // Get the explosion item actor
3870  if( i->type->get_use( "explosion" ) != nullptr ) {
3871  const explosion_iuse *actor = dynamic_cast<const explosion_iuse *>(
3872  i->type->get_use( "explosion" )->get_actor_ptr() );
3873  if( actor != nullptr ) {
3874  // If we're looking at another bomb, don't blow it up early for now.
3875  // i++ here because we aren't iterating in the loop header.
3876  i++;
3877  continue;
3878  }
3879  }
3880  }
3881 
3882  const float material_factor = i->chip_resistance( true );
3883  if( power < material_factor ) {
3884  i++;
3885  continue;
3886  }
3887 
3888  // The volume check here pretty much only influences corpses and very large items
3889  const float volume_factor = std::max<float>( 40, i->volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor );
3890  float damage_chance = 10.0f * power / volume_factor;
3891  // Example:
3892  // Power 40 (just below C4 epicenter) vs plank
3893  // damage_chance = 10 * 40 / 40 = 10, material_factor = 8
3894  // Will deal 1 damage, then 20% chance for another point
3895  // Power 20 (grenade minus shrapnel) vs glass bottle
3896  // 10 * 20 / 40 = 5 vs 1
3897  // 5 damage (destruction)
3898 
3899  const bool by_charges = i->count_by_charges();
3900  // See if they were damaged
3901  if( by_charges ) {
3902  damage_chance *= i->charges_per_volume( 250_ml );
3903  while( ( damage_chance > material_factor ||
3904  x_in_y( damage_chance, material_factor ) ) &&
3905  i->charges > 0 ) {
3906  i->charges--;
3907  damage_chance -= material_factor;
3908  // We can't increment items_damaged directly because a single item can be damaged more than once
3909  item_was_damaged = true;
3910  }
3911  } else {
3912  const field_type_id type_blood = i->is_corpse() ? i->get_mtype()->bloodType() : fd_null;
3913  while( ( damage_chance > material_factor || x_in_y( damage_chance, material_factor ) ) &&
3914  ( i->damage() < i->max_damage() ) ) {
3915  i->inc_damage();
3916  add_splash( type_blood, p, 1, damage_chance );
3917  damage_chance -= material_factor;
3918  item_was_damaged = true;
3919  }
3920  }
3921 
3922  // If an item was damaged, increment the counter and set it as most recently damaged.
3923  if( item_was_damaged ) {
3924 
3925  // If this is the first item to be damaged, store its name in damaged_item_name.
3926  if( items_damaged == 0 ) {
3927  damaged_item_name = i->tname();
3928  }
3929  // Increment the counter, and reset the flag.
3930  items_damaged++;
3931  item_was_damaged = false;
3932  }
3933 
3934  // Remove them if they were damaged too much
3935  if( i->damage() == i->max_damage() || ( by_charges && i->charges == 0 ) ) {
3936  // But save the contents, except for irremovable gunmods
3937  for( item *elem : i->all_items_top() ) {
3938  if( !elem->is_irremovable() ) {
3939  contents.emplace_back( *elem );
3940  }
3941  }
3942 
3943  i = i_rem( p, i );
3944  items_destroyed++;
3945  } else {
3946  i++;
3947  }
3948  }
3949 
3950  // Let the player know that the item was damaged if they can see it.
3951  if( items_destroyed > 1 ) {
3952  add_msg_if_player_sees( p, m_bad, _( "The %s destroys several items!" ), cause_message );
3953  } else if( items_destroyed == 1 && items_damaged == 1 ) {
3954  //~ %1$s: the cause of destruction, %2$s: destroyed item name
3955  add_msg_if_player_sees( p, m_bad, _( "The %1$s destroys the %2$s!" ), cause_message,
3956  damaged_item_name );
3957  } else if( items_damaged > 1 ) {
3958  add_msg_if_player_sees( p, m_bad, _( "The %s damages several items." ), cause_message );
3959  } else if( items_damaged == 1 ) {
3960  //~ %1$s: the cause of damage, %2$s: damaged item name
3961  add_msg_if_player_sees( p, m_bad, _( "The %1$s damages the %2$s." ), cause_message,
3962  damaged_item_name );
3963  }
3964 
3965  for( const item &it : contents ) {
3966  add_item_or_charges( p, it );
3967  }
3968 }
3969 
3970 ter_str_id map::get_roof( const tripoint &p, const bool allow_air ) const
3971 {
3972  // This function should not be called from the 2D mode
3973  // Just use t_dirt instead
3974  cata_assert( zlevels );
3975 
3976  if( p.z <= -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
3977  // Could be magma/"void" instead
3978  return ter_t_rock_floor;
3979  }
3980 
3981  const ter_t &ter_there = ter( p ).obj();
3982  const ter_str_id &roof = ter_there.roof;
3983  if( !roof ) {
3984  // No roof
3985  // Not acceptable if the tile is not passable
3986  if( !allow_air ) {
3987  return ter_t_dirt;
3988  }
3989 
3990  return ter_t_open_air;
3991  }
3992  if( roof == ter_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
3993  debugmsg( "map::get_new_floor: %d,%d,%d has invalid roof type %s",
3994  p.x, p.y, p.z, roof.c_str() );
3995  return ter_t_dirt;
3996  }
3997 
3998  if( p.z == -1 && roof == ter_t_rock_floor ) {
3999  // HACK: A hack to work around not having a "solid earth" tile
4000  return ter_t_dirt;
4001  }
4002 
4003  return roof;
4004 }
4005 
4006 // Check if there is supporting furniture cardinally adjacent to the bashed furniture
4007 // For example, a washing machine behind the bashed door
4008 static bool furn_is_supported( const map &m, const tripoint &p )
4009 {
4010  static constexpr std::array<int8_t, 4> cx = { 0, -1, 0, 1};
4011  static constexpr std::array<int8_t, 4> cy = { -1, 0, 1, 0};
4012 
4013  for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
4014  const point adj( p.xy() + point( cx[i], cy[i] ) );
4015  if( m.has_furn( tripoint( adj, p.z ) ) &&
4016  m.furn( tripoint( adj, p.z ) ).obj().has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_BLOCKSDOOR ) ) {
4017  return true;
4018  }
4019  }
4020 
4021  return false;
4022 }
4023 
4024 void map::bash_ter_furn( const tripoint &p, bash_params &params )
4025 {
4026  int sound_volume = 0;
4027  std::string soundfxid;
4028  std::string soundfxvariant;
4029  const ter_t &terid = ter( p ).obj();
4030  const furn_t &furnid = furn( p ).obj();
4031  bool smash_furn = false;
4032  bool smash_ter = false;
4033  const map_bash_info *bash = nullptr;
4034 
4035  bool success = false;
4036 
4037  if( has_furn( p ) && furnid.bash.str_max != -1 ) {
4038  bash = &furnid.bash;
4039  smash_furn = true;
4040  } else if( ter( p ).obj().bash.str_max != -1 ) {
4041  bash = &ter( p ).obj().bash;
4042  smash_ter = true;
4043  }
4044 
4045  // Floor bashing check
4046  // Only allow bashing floors when we want to bash floors and we're in z-level mode
4047  // Unless we're destroying, then it gets a little weird
4048  if( smash_ter && bash->bash_below && ( !zlevels || !params.bash_floor ) ) {
4049  if( !params.destroy ) { // NOLINT(bugprone-branch-clone)
4050  smash_ter = false;
4051  bash = nullptr;
4052  } else if( !bash->ter_set && zlevels ) {
4053  // HACK: A hack for destroy && !bash_floor
4054  // We have to check what would we create and cancel if it is what we have now
4055  tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
4056  const ter_str_id roof = get_roof( below, false );
4057  if( ter( p ) == roof ) {
4058  smash_ter = false;
4059  bash = nullptr;
4060  }
4061  } else if( !bash->ter_set && ter( p ) == ter_t_dirt ) {
4062  // As above, except for no-z-levels case
4063  smash_ter = false;
4064  bash = nullptr;
4065  }
4066  }
4067 
4068  if( bash == nullptr || ( bash->destroy_only && !params.destroy ) ) {
4069  // Nothing bashable here
4070  if( impassable( p ) ) {
4071  if( !params.silent ) {
4072  sounds::sound( p, 18, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "thump!" ),
4073  false, "smash_fail", "default" );
4074  }
4075 
4076  params.did_bash = true;
4077  params.bashed_solid = true;
4078  }
4079 
4080  return;
4081  }
4082 
4083  int smin = bash->str_min;
4084  int smax = bash->str_max;
4085  int sound_vol = bash->sound_vol;
4086  int sound_fail_vol = bash->sound_fail_vol;
4087  if( !params.destroy ) {
4088  if( bash->str_min_blocked != -1 || bash->str_max_blocked != -1 ) {
4089  if( furn_is_supported( *this, p ) ) {
4090  if( bash->str_min_blocked != -1 ) {
4091  smin = bash->str_min_blocked;
4092  }
4093  if( bash->str_max_blocked != -1 ) {
4094  smax = bash->str_max_blocked;
4095  }
4096  }
4097  }
4098 
4099  if( bash->str_min_supported != -1 || bash->str_max_supported != -1 ) {
4100  tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
4101  if( !zlevels || has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, below ) ) {
4102  if( bash->str_min_supported != -1 ) {
4103  smin = bash->str_min_supported;
4104  }
4105  if( bash->str_max_supported != -1 ) {
4106  smax = bash->str_max_supported;
4107  }
4108  }
4109  }
4110  // Semi-persistant map damage. Increment by one for each bash over smin
4111  // Gradually makes hard bashes easier
4112  int damage = get_map_damage( tripoint_bub_ms( p ) );
4113  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MAP,
4114  "Bashing difficulty %d, threshold is %d. Strength is %d + %d, added damage %d", smax, smin,
4115  params.strength, damage, std::max( ( params.strength - smin ) * params.roll, 0.f ) );
4116  if( params.strength + damage >= smax ) {
4117  damage = 0;
4118  success = true;
4119  } else if( params.strength >= smin ) {
4120  // Add at least one damage per unsuccessful bash will ensure that if we exceed str_min,
4121  // we will destroy it in str_max - str_min bashes. As the amount we exceed it by increases,
4122  // we'll take less time to destroy it
4123  damage += std::max( ( params.strength - smin ) * params.roll, 1.f );
4124  }
4125  set_map_damage( tripoint_bub_ms( p ), damage );
4126  }
4127 
4128  if( smash_furn ) {
4129  soundfxvariant = furnid.id.str();
4130  } else {
4131  soundfxvariant = terid.id.str();
4132  }
4133 
4134  if( !params.destroy && !success ) {
4135  if( sound_fail_vol == -1 ) {
4136  sound_volume = 12;
4137  } else {
4138  sound_volume = sound_fail_vol;
4139  }
4140 
4141  params.did_bash = true;
4142  if( !params.silent ) {
4143  sounds::sound( p, sound_volume, sounds::sound_t::combat, bash->sound_fail, false,
4144  "smash_fail", soundfxvariant );
4145  }
4146 
4147  return;
4148  }
4149 
4150  // Clear out any partially grown seeds
4151  if( has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_PLANT, p ) ) {
4152  i_clear( p );
4153  }
4154 
4155  if( ( smash_furn && has_flag_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FUNGUS, p ) ) ||
4156  ( smash_ter && has_flag_ter( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FUNGUS, p ) ) ) {
4157  fungal_effects().create_spores( p );
4158  }
4159 
4160  if( params.destroy ) {
4161  sound_volume = smin * 2;
4162  } else {
4163  if( sound_vol == -1 ) {
4164  sound_volume = std::min( static_cast<int>( smin * 1.5 ), smax );
4165  } else {
4166  sound_volume = sound_vol;
4167  }
4168  }
4169 
4170  soundfxid = "smash_success";
4171  const translation &sound = bash->sound;
4172  // Set this now in case the ter_set below changes this
4173  const bool will_collapse = smash_ter &&
4174  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, p ) && !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS, p );
4175  const bool tent = smash_furn && !bash->tent_centers.empty();
4176 
4177  // Special code to collapse the tent if destroyed
4178  if( tent ) {
4179  // Get ids of possible centers
4180  std::set<furn_id> centers;
4181  for( const auto &cur_id : bash->tent_centers ) {
4182  if( cur_id.is_valid() ) {
4183  centers.insert( cur_id );
4184  }
4185  }
4186 
4187  std::optional<std::pair<tripoint, furn_id>> tentp;
4188 
4189  // Find the center of the tent
4190  // First check if we're not currently bashing the center
4191  if( centers.count( furn( p ) ) > 0 ) {
4192  tentp.emplace( p, furn( p ) );
4193  } else {
4194  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( p, bash->collapse_radius ) ) {
4195  const furn_id &f_at = furn( pt );
4196  // Check if we found the center of the current tent
4197  if( centers.count( f_at ) > 0 ) {
4198  tentp.emplace( pt, f_at );
4199  break;
4200  }
4201  }
4202  }
4203  // Didn't find any tent center, wreck the current tile
4204  if( !tentp ) {
4205  spawn_items( p, item_group::items_from( bash->drop_group, calendar::turn ) );
4206  furn_set( p, bash->furn_set );
4207  } else {
4208  // Take the tent down
4209  const int rad = tentp->second.obj().bash.collapse_radius;
4210  for( const tripoint &pt : points_in_radius( tentp->first, rad ) ) {
4211  const furn_id frn = furn( pt );
4212  if( frn == furn_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
4213  continue;
4214  }
4215 
4216  const map_bash_info *recur_bash = &frn.obj().bash;
4217  // Check if we share a center type and thus a "tent type"
4218  for( const auto &cur_id : recur_bash->tent_centers ) {
4219  if( centers.count( cur_id.id() ) > 0 ) {
4220  // Found same center, wreck current tile
4221  spawn_items( p, item_group::items_from( recur_bash->drop_group, calendar::turn ) );
4222  furn_set( pt, recur_bash->furn_set );
4223  break;
4224  }
4225  }
4226  }
4227  }
4228  soundfxvariant = "smash_cloth";
4229  } else if( smash_furn ) {
4230  furn_set( p, bash->furn_set );
4231  for( item &it : i_at( p ) ) {
4232  it.on_drop( p, *this );
4233  }
4234  // HACK: Hack alert.
4235  // Signs have cosmetics associated with them on the submap since
4236  // furniture can't store dynamic data to disk. To prevent writing
4237  // mysteriously appearing for a sign later built here, remove the
4238  // writing from the submap.
4239  delete_signage( p );
4240  } else if( !smash_ter ) {
4241  // Handle error earlier so that we can assume smash_ter is true below
4242  debugmsg( "data/json/terrain.json does not have %s.bash.ter_set set!",
4243  ter( p ).obj().id.c_str() );
4244  } else if( params.bashing_from_above && bash->ter_set_bashed_from_above ) {
4245  // If this terrain is being bashed from above and this terrain
4246  // has a valid post-destroy bashed-from-above terrain, set it
4247  ter_set( p, bash->ter_set_bashed_from_above );
4248  } else if( bash->ter_set ) {
4249  // If the terrain has a valid post-destroy terrain, set it
4250  ter_set( p, bash->ter_set );
4251  } else {
4252  tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
4253  const ter_t &ter_below = ter( below ).obj();
4254  if( bash->bash_below && ter_below.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF ) ) {
4255  // When bashing the tile below, don't allow bashing the floor
4256  bash_params params_below = params; // Make a copy
4257  params_below.bashing_from_above = true;
4258  bash_ter_furn( below, params_below );
4259  }
4260 
4261  furn_set( p, furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
4262  ter_set( p, ter_t_open_air );
4263  }
4264 
4265  if( !tent ) {
4266  spawn_items( p, item_group::items_from( bash->drop_group, calendar::turn ) );
4267  }
4268 
4269  if( smash_ter && ter( p )->has_flag( "EMPTY_SPACE" ) && zlevels ) {
4270  tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
4271  const ter_str_id roof = get_roof( below, params.bash_floor && ter( below ).obj().movecost != 0 );
4272  ter_set( p, roof );
4273  }
4274 
4275  if( bash->explosive > 0 ) {
4276  explosion_handler::explosion( nullptr, p, bash->explosive, 0.8, false );
4277  }
4278 
4279  if( will_collapse && !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SUPPORTS_ROOF, p ) ) {
4280  collapse_at( p, params.silent, true, bash->explosive > 0 );
4281  }
4282 
4283  params.did_bash = true;
4284  params.success |= success; // Not always true, so that we can tell when to stop destroying
4285  params.bashed_solid = true;
4286  if( !sound.empty() && !params.silent ) {
4287  sounds::sound( p, sound_volume, sounds::sound_t::combat, sound, false,
4288  soundfxid, soundfxvariant );
4289  }
4290 }
4291 
4292 bash_params map::bash( const tripoint &p, const int str,
4293  bool silent, bool destroy, bool bash_floor,
4294  const vehicle *bashing_vehicle )
4295 {
4296  bash_params bsh{
4297  str, silent, destroy, bash_floor, static_cast<float>( rng_float( 0, 1.0f ) ), false, false, false, false
4298  };
4299  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4300  return bsh;
4301  }
4302 
4303  bool bashed_sealed = false;
4304  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEALED, p ) ) {
4305  bash_ter_furn( p, bsh );
4306  bashed_sealed = true;
4307  }
4308 
4309  bash_field( p, bsh );
4310 
4311  // Don't bash items inside terrain/furniture with SEALED flag
4312  if( !bashed_sealed ) {
4313  bash_items( p, bsh );
4314  }
4315  // Don't bash the vehicle doing the bashing
4316  const vehicle *veh = veh_pointer_or_null( veh_at( p ) );
4317  if( veh != nullptr && veh != bashing_vehicle ) {
4318  bash_vehicle( p, bsh );
4319  }
4320 
4321  // If we still didn't bash anything solid (a vehicle) or a tile with SEALED flag, bash ter/furn
4322  if( !bsh.bashed_solid && !bashed_sealed ) {
4323  bash_ter_furn( p, bsh );
4324  }
4325 
4326  return bsh;
4327 }
4328 
4329 void map::bash_items( const tripoint &p, bash_params &params )
4330 {
4331  if( !has_items( p ) || has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_PLANT, p ) ) {
4332  return;
4333  }
4334 
4335  std::vector<item> smashed_contents;
4336  map_stack bashed_items = i_at( p );
4337  bool smashed_glass = false;
4338  for( auto bashed_item = bashed_items.begin(); bashed_item != bashed_items.end(); ) {
4339  // the check for active suppresses Molotovs smashing themselves with their own explosion
4340  int glass_portion = bashed_item->made_of( material_glass );
4341  float glass_fraction = glass_portion / static_cast<float>( bashed_item->type->mat_portion_total );
4342  if( glass_portion && !bashed_item->active && rng_float( 0.0f, 1.0f ) < glass_fraction * 0.5f ) {
4343  params.did_bash = true;
4344  smashed_glass = true;
4345  for( const item *bashed_content : bashed_item->all_items_top() ) {
4346  smashed_contents.emplace_back( *bashed_content );
4347  }
4348  bashed_item = bashed_items.erase( bashed_item );
4349  } else {
4350  ++bashed_item;
4351  }
4352  }
4353  // Now plunk in the contents of the smashed items.
4354  spawn_items( p, smashed_contents );
4355 
4356  // Add a glass sound even when something else also breaks
4357  if( smashed_glass && !params.silent ) {
4358  sounds::sound( p, 12, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "glass shattering." ), false,
4359  "smash_success", "smash_glass_contents" );
4360  }
4361 }
4362 
4363 void map::bash_vehicle( const tripoint &p, bash_params &params )
4364 {
4365  // Smash vehicle if present
4366  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p ) ) {
4367  vp->vehicle().damage( *this, vp->part_index(), params.strength, damage_bash );
4368  if( !params.silent ) {
4369  sounds::sound( p, 18, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "crash!" ), false,
4370  "smash_success", "hit_vehicle" );
4371  }
4372 
4373  params.did_bash = true;
4374  params.success = true;
4375  params.bashed_solid = true;
4376  }
4377 }
4378 
4379 void map::bash_field( const tripoint &p, bash_params &params )
4380 {
4381  std::vector<field_type_id> to_remove;
4382  for( const std::pair<const field_type_id, field_entry> &fd : field_at( p ) ) {
4383  if( fd.first->bash_info.str_min > -1 ) {
4384  params.did_bash = true;
4385  params.bashed_solid = true; // To prevent bashing furniture/vehicles
4386  to_remove.push_back( fd.first );
4387  }
4388  }
4389  for( field_type_id fd : to_remove ) {
4390  remove_field( p, fd );
4391  }
4392 }
4393 
4394 void map::destroy( const tripoint &p, const bool silent )
4395 {
4396  // Break if it takes more than 25 destructions to remove to prevent infinite loops
4397  // Example: A bashes to B, B bashes to A leads to A->B->A->...
4398  int count = 0;
4399  while( count <= 25 && bash( p, 999, silent, true ).success ) {
4400  count++;
4401  }
4402 }
4403 
4404 void map::destroy_furn( const tripoint &p, const bool silent )
4405 {
4406  // Break if it takes more than 25 destructions to remove to prevent infinite loops
4407  // Example: A bashes to B, B bashes to A leads to A->B->A->...
4408  int count = 0;
4409  while( count <= 25 && furn( p ) != furn_str_id::NULL_ID() &&
4410  bash( p, 999, silent, true ).success ) {
4411  count++;
4412  }
4413 }
4414 
4415 void map::destroy_furn( const tripoint_bub_ms &p, const bool silent )
4416 {
4417  destroy_furn( p.raw(), silent );
4418 }
4419 
4420 void map::batter( const tripoint &p, int power, int tries, const bool silent )
4421 {
4422  int count = 0;
4423  while( count < tries && bash( p, power, silent ).success ) {
4424  count++;
4425  }
4426 }
4427 
4428 void map::crush( const tripoint &p )
4429 {
4430  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
4431  Character *crushed_player = creatures.creature_at<Character>( p );
4432 
4433  if( crushed_player != nullptr ) {
4434  bool player_inside = false;
4435  if( crushed_player->in_vehicle ) {
4436  const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p );
4437  player_inside = vp && vp->is_inside();
4438  }
4439  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
4440  if( !player_inside ) { //If there's a player at p and he's not in a covered vehicle...
4441  //This is the roof coming down on top of us, no chance to dodge
4442  crushed_player->add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "You are crushed by the falling debris!" ),
4443  _( "<npcname> is crushed by the falling debris!" ) );
4444  // TODO: Make this depend on the ceiling material
4445  const int dam = rng( 0, 40 );
4446  // Torso and head take the brunt of the blow
4447  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "head" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4448  dam * .25 ) );
4449  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4450  dam * .45 ) );
4451  // Legs take the next most through transferred force
4452  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "leg_l" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4453  dam * .10 ) );
4454  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "leg_r" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4455  dam * .10 ) );
4456  // Arms take the least
4457  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "arm_l" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4458  dam * .05 ) );
4459  crushed_player->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "arm_r" ), damage_instance( damage_bash,
4460  dam * .05 ) );
4461 
4462  // Pin whoever got hit
4463  crushed_player->add_effect( effect_crushed, 1_turns, true );
4464  crushed_player->check_dead_state();
4465  }
4466  }
4467 
4468  if( monster *const monhit = creatures.creature_at<monster>( p ) ) {
4469  // 25 ~= 60 * .45 (torso)
4470  monhit->deal_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( damage_bash, rng( 0,
4471  25 ) ) );
4472 
4473  // Pin whoever got hit
4474  monhit->add_effect( effect_crushed, 1_turns, true );
4475  monhit->check_dead_state();
4476  }
4477 
4478  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p ) ) {
4479  // Arbitrary number is better than collapsing house roof crushing APCs
4480  vp->vehicle().damage( *this, vp->part_index(), rng( 100, 1000 ), damage_bash, false );
4481  }
4482 }
4483 
4484 void map::shoot( const tripoint &p, projectile &proj, const bool hit_items )
4485 {
4486  // TODO: make bashing better a destroying, worse at penetrating
4487  std::map<damage_type_id, float> dmg_by_type {};
4488  for( const damage_unit &dam : proj.impact ) {
4489  dmg_by_type[dam.type] +=
4490  dam.amount * dam.damage_multiplier * dam.unconditional_damage_mult +
4491  dam.res_pen * dam.res_mult * dam.unconditional_res_mult;
4492  }
4493  const float initial_damage = std::accumulate( dmg_by_type.begin(), dmg_by_type.end(), 0.0f,
4494  []( float acc, const std::pair<const damage_type_id, float> &dmg ) {
4495  return acc + dmg.second;
4496  } );
4497  if( initial_damage < 0 ) {
4498  return;
4499  }
4500  // TODO: use this for more than just vehicle parts
4501  const damage_type_id &main_damage_type = std::max_element( dmg_by_type.begin(), dmg_by_type.end(),
4502  []( const std::pair<const damage_type_id, float> &a,
4503  const std::pair<const damage_type_id, float> &b ) {
4504  return a.second < b.second;
4505  } )->first;
4506 
4507  // damage value that may be reduced by vehicles, furniture, terrain or fields
4508  float dam = initial_damage;
4509 
4510  const auto &ammo_effects = proj.proj_effects;
4511  const bool incendiary = ammo_effects.count( "INCENDIARY" );
4512  const bool ignite = ammo_effects.count( "IGNITE" );
4513  const bool laser = ammo_effects.count( "LASER" );
4514 
4515  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p ) ) {
4516  dam = vp->vehicle().damage( *this, vp->part_index(), dam, main_damage_type, hit_items );
4517  }
4518 
4519  // This lambda is only called if the furniture/terrain has shoot data!
4520  const auto shoot_furn_ter = [&]( const map_data_common_t &data ) {
4521  const map_shoot_info &shoot = *data.shoot;
4522  bool destroyed = false;
4523 
4524  // if you are aiming at this tile, you can never miss
4525  if( hit_items || x_in_y( shoot.chance_to_hit, 100 ) ) {
4526  if( laser ) {
4527  dam -= rng( shoot.reduce_dmg_min_laser, shoot.reduce_dmg_max_laser );
4528  } else {
4529  dam -= rng( shoot.reduce_dmg_min, shoot.reduce_dmg_max );
4530  }
4531  // lasers can't destroy some types of furn/ter you can shoot through
4532  if( !laser || !shoot.no_laser_destroy ) {
4533  // important to use initial damage, energy from reduction has gone into the furn/ter
4534  const int min_damage = int( initial_damage ) - shoot.destroy_dmg_min;
4535  const int max_damage = shoot.destroy_dmg_max - shoot.destroy_dmg_min;
4536  if( x_in_y( min_damage, max_damage ) ) {
4537  // don't need to duplicate all the destruction logic here
4538  bash_params bsh{ 0, false, true, false, 0.0, false, false, false, false };
4539  bash_ter_furn( p, bsh );
4540  destroyed = true;
4541  }
4542  }
4543  if( dam <= 0 && get_player_view().sees( p ) ) {
4544  add_msg( _( "The shot is stopped by the %s!" ), data.name() );
4545  }
4546  // only very flammable furn/ter can be set alight with incendiary rounds
4547  if( data.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE_ASH ) ) {
4548  if( incendiary && x_in_y( 1, 10 ) ) { // 10% chance
4549  add_field( p, fd_fire, 1 );
4550  }
4551  if( ignite ) {
4552  add_field( p, fd_fire, 1 );
4553  }
4554  }
4555  // bash_ter_furn already triggers the alarm
4556  // TODO: fix alarm event weirdness (not just here, also in bash, hack, etc)
4557  if( !destroyed && data.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_ALARMED ) ) {
4558  sounds::sound( p, 40, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "an alarm go off!" ),
4559  false, "environment", "alarm" );
4560  }
4561  return true;
4562  }
4563  return false;
4564  };
4565 
4566  furn_id furniture = furn( p );
4567  ter_id terrain = ter( p );
4568  bool hit_something = false;
4569 
4570  // shoot through furniture or terrain and see if we hit something
4571  if( furniture->shoot ) { // Shoot data is optional, most furniture will never trigger this
4572  hit_something |= shoot_furn_ter( furniture.obj() );
4573  } else if( terrain->shoot ) { // Shoot data is optional, most terrain will never trigger this
4574  hit_something |= shoot_furn_ter( terrain.obj() );
4575  // fall back to just bashing when shoot data is not defined
4576  } else if( impassable( p ) && !is_transparent( p ) ) {
4577  bash( p, dam, false );
4578  dam = 0;
4579  }
4580  dam = std::max( 0.0f, dam );
4581 
4582  for( const ammo_effect &ae : ammo_effects::get_all() ) {
4583  if( ammo_effects.count( ae.id.str() ) > 0 ) {
4584  if( x_in_y( ae.trail_chance, 100 ) ) {
4585  add_field( p, ae.trail_field_type, rng( ae.trail_intensity_min, ae.trail_intensity_max ) );
4586  }
4587  }
4588  }
4589 
4590  // Check fields?
4591  field &fields_there = field_at( p );
4592  if( fields_there.field_count() > 0 ) {
4593  // Need to make a copy since 'remove_field' modifies the value
4594  field fields_copy = fields_there;
4595  for( const std::pair<const field_type_id, field_entry> &fd : fields_copy ) {
4596  if( fd.first->bash_info.str_min > 0 ) {
4597  if( incendiary ) {
4598  add_field( p, fd_fire, fd.second.get_field_intensity() - 1 );
4599  } else if( dam > 5 + fd.second.get_field_intensity() * 5 &&
4600  one_in( 5 - fd.second.get_field_intensity() ) ) {
4601  dam -= rng( 1, 2 + fd.second.get_field_intensity() * 2 );
4602  remove_field( p, fd.first );
4603  }
4604  }
4605  }
4606  }
4607 
4608  // Rescale the damage
4609  if( dam <= 0 ) {
4610  proj.impact.damage_units.clear();
4611  return;
4612  } else if( dam < initial_damage ) {
4613  proj.impact.mult_damage( dam / static_cast<double>( initial_damage ) );
4614  }
4615 
4616  // for now, shooting furniture or terrain protects any items
4617  if( !hit_items || hit_something ) {
4618  return;
4619  }
4620 
4621  // Make sure the message is sensible for the ammo effects. Lasers aren't projectiles.
4622  std::string damage_message;
4623  if( ammo_effects.count( "LASER" ) ) {
4624  damage_message = _( "laser beam" );
4625  } else if( ammo_effects.count( "LIGHTNING" ) ) {
4626  damage_message = _( "bolt of electricity" );
4627  } else if( ammo_effects.count( "PLASMA" ) ) {
4628  damage_message = _( "bolt of plasma" );
4629  } else {
4630  damage_message = _( "flying projectile" );
4631  }
4632 
4633  // Now, smash items on that tile.
4634  // dam / 3, because bullets aren't all that good at destroying items...
4635  smash_items( p, dam / 3, damage_message );
4636 }
4637 
4638 bool map::hit_with_acid( const tripoint &p )
4639 {
4640  if( passable( p ) ) {
4641  return false; // Didn't hit the tile!
4642  }
4643  const ter_id t = ter( p );
4644  if( t == ter_t_wall_glass || t == ter_t_wall_glass_alarm ||
4645  t == ter_t_vat ) {
4646  ter_set( p, ter_t_floor );
4647  } else if( t == ter_t_door_c || t == ter_t_door_locked || t == ter_t_door_locked_peep ||
4648  t == ter_t_door_locked_alarm ) {
4649  if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
4650  ter_set( p, ter_t_door_b );
4651  }
4652  } else if( t == ter_t_door_bar_c || t == ter_t_door_bar_o || t == ter_t_door_bar_locked ||
4653  t == ter_t_bars ||
4654  t == ter_t_reb_cage ) {
4655  ter_set( p, ter_t_floor );
4656  add_msg_if_player_sees( p, m_warning, _( "The metal bars melt!" ) );
4657  } else if( t == ter_t_door_b ) {
4658  if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
4659  ter_set( p, ter_t_door_frame );
4660  } else {
4661  return false;
4662  }
4663  } else if( t == ter_t_window || t == ter_t_window_alarm || t == ter_t_window_no_curtains ) {
4664  ter_set( p, ter_t_window_empty );
4665  } else if( t == ter_t_wax ) {
4666  ter_set( p, ter_t_floor_wax );
4667  } else if( t == ter_t_gas_pump || t == ter_t_gas_pump_smashed ) {
4668  return false;
4669  } else if( t == ter_t_card_science || t == ter_t_card_military || t == ter_t_card_industrial ) {
4670  ter_set( p, ter_t_card_reader_broken );
4671  }
4672  return true;
4673 }
4674 
4675 // returns true if terrain stops fire
4676 bool map::hit_with_fire( const tripoint &p )
4677 {
4678  if( passable( p ) ) {
4679  return false; // Didn't hit the tile!
4680  }
4681 
4682  // non passable but flammable terrain, set it on fire
4683  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE, p ) ||
4684  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAMMABLE_ASH, p ) ) {
4685  add_field( p, fd_fire, 3 );
4686  }
4687  return true;
4688 }
4689 bool map::open_door( Creature const &u, const tripoint &p, const bool inside,
4690  const bool check_only )
4691 {
4692  if( u.has_effect( effect_incorporeal ) ) {
4693  return false;
4694  }
4695  const ter_t &ter = this->ter( p ).obj();
4696  const furn_t &furn = this->furn( p ).obj();
4697  if( ter.open ) {
4698  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_OPENCLOSE_INSIDE, p ) && !inside ) {
4699  return false;
4700  }
4701 
4702  if( !check_only ) {
4703  sounds::sound( p, 6, sounds::sound_t::movement, _( "swish" ), true,
4704  "open_door", ter.id.str() );
4705  ter_set( p, ter.open );
4706 
4707  if( u.has_trait( trait_SCHIZOPHRENIC ) && u.is_avatar() &&
4708  one_in( 50 ) && !ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_TRANSPARENT ) ) {
4709  tripoint mp = p + -2 * u.pos().xy() + tripoint( 2 * p.x, 2 * p.y, p.z );
4710  g->spawn_hallucination( mp );
4711  }
4712  }
4713 
4714  return true;
4715  } else if( furn.open ) {
4716  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_OPENCLOSE_INSIDE, p ) && !inside ) {
4717  return false;
4718  }
4719 
4720  if( !check_only ) {
4721  sounds::sound( p, 6, sounds::sound_t::movement, _( "swish" ), true,
4722  "open_door", furn.id.str() );
4723  furn_set( p, furn.open );
4724  }
4725 
4726  return true;
4727  } else if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p ) ) {
4728  const optional_vpart_position creature_veh = veh_at( u.pos() );
4729  const bool creature_outside = !creature_veh.has_value() ||
4730  &creature_veh->vehicle() != &veh_at( p )->vehicle();
4731 
4732  const int openable = vp->vehicle().next_part_to_open( vp->part_index(), creature_outside );
4733  if( openable >= 0 ) {
4734  if( !check_only ) {
4735  if( ( u.is_npc() || u.is_avatar() ) &&
4736  !vp->vehicle().handle_potential_theft( *u.as_character() ) ) {
4737  return false;
4738  }
4739  vp->vehicle().open_all_at( openable );
4740  }
4741 
4742  return true;
4743  }
4744 
4745  return false;
4746  }
4747 
4748  return false;
4749 }
4750 
4751 void map::translate( const ter_id &from, const ter_id &to )
4752 {
4753  if( from == to ) {
4754  debugmsg( "map::translate %s => %s",
4755  from.obj().name(),
4756  from.obj().name() );
4757  return;
4758  }
4759  for( const tripoint &p : points_on_zlevel() ) {
4760  if( ter( p ) == from ) {
4761  ter_set( p, to );
4762  }
4763  }
4764 }
4765 
4766 //This function performs the translate function within a given radius of the player.
4767 void map::translate_radius( const ter_id &from, const ter_id &to, float radi, const tripoint &p,
4768  const bool same_submap, const bool toggle_between )
4769 {
4770  if( from == to ) {
4771  debugmsg( "map::translate %s => %s", from.obj().name(), to.obj().name() );
4772  return;
4773  }
4774 
4775  const tripoint abs_omt_p = ms_to_omt_copy( getabs( p ) );
4776  for( const tripoint &t : points_on_zlevel() ) {
4777  const tripoint abs_omt_t = ms_to_omt_copy( getabs( t ) );
4778  const float radiX = trig_dist( p, t );
4779  if( ter( t ) == from ) {
4780  // within distance, and either no submap limitation or same overmap coords.
4781  if( radiX <= radi && ( !same_submap || abs_omt_t == abs_omt_p ) ) {
4782  ter_set( t, to );
4783  }
4784  } else if( toggle_between && ter( t ) == to ) {
4785  if( radiX <= radi && ( !same_submap || abs_omt_t == abs_omt_p ) ) {
4786  ter_set( t, from );
4787  }
4788  }
4789  }
4790 }
4791 
4792 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-make-member-function-const)
4793 void map::transform_radius( const ter_furn_transform_id &transform, int radi,
4794  const tripoint_abs_ms &p )
4795 {
4796  if( !inbounds( p - point( radi, radi ) ) || !inbounds( p + point( radi, radi ) ) ) {
4797  debugmsg( "transform_radius called for area out of bounds" );
4798  }
4799  tripoint_bub_ms const loc = bub_from_abs( p );
4800  for( tripoint_bub_ms const &t : points_in_radius( loc, radi, 0 ) ) {
4801  if( trig_dist( loc, t ) <= radi ) {
4802  transform->transform( *this, t );
4803  }
4804  }
4805 }
4806 
4807 void map::transform_line( const ter_furn_transform_id &transform, const tripoint_abs_ms &first,
4808  const tripoint_abs_ms &second )
4809 {
4810  if( !inbounds( first ) || !inbounds( second ) ) {
4811  debugmsg( "transform_line called for line out of bounds" );
4812  }
4813  for( const tripoint_abs_ms &t : line_to( first, second ) ) {
4814  transform->transform( *this, bub_from_abs( t ) );
4815  }
4816 }
4817 
4818 bool map::close_door( const tripoint &p, const bool inside, const bool check_only )
4819 {
4820  if( has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_OPENCLOSE_INSIDE, p ) && !inside ) {
4821  return false;
4822  }
4823 
4824  const ter_t &ter = this->ter( p ).obj();
4825  const furn_t &furn = this->furn( p ).obj();
4826  if( ter.close && !furn.id ) {
4827  if( !check_only ) {
4828  sounds::sound( p, 10, sounds::sound_t::movement, _( "swish" ), true,
4829  "close_door", ter.id.str() );
4830  ter_set( p, ter.close );
4831  }
4832  return true;
4833  } else if( furn.close ) {
4834  if( !check_only ) {
4835  sounds::sound( p, 10, sounds::sound_t::movement, _( "swish" ), true,
4836  "close_door", furn.id.str() );
4837  furn_set( p, furn.close );
4838  }
4839  return true;
4840  }
4841  return false;
4842 }
4843 
4844 bool map::close_door( const tripoint_bub_ms &p, const bool inside, const bool check_only )
4845 {
4846  return close_door( p.raw(), inside, check_only );
4847 }
4848 
4849 std::string map::get_signage( const tripoint &p ) const
4850 {
4851  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4852  return "";
4853  }
4854 
4855  point l;
4856  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
4857  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
4858  debugmsg( "Tried to get signage at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
4859  return std::string();
4860  }
4861 
4862  return current_submap->get_signage( l );
4863 }
4864 void map::set_signage( const tripoint &p, const std::string &message )
4865 {
4866  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4867  return;
4868  }
4869 
4870  point l;
4871  submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
4872  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
4873  debugmsg( "Tried set signage at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
4874  return;
4875  }
4876 
4877  current_submap->set_signage( l, message );
4878 }
4879 void map::delete_signage( const tripoint &p )
4880 {
4881  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4882  return;
4883  }
4884 
4885  point l;
4886  submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
4887  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
4888  debugmsg( "Tried to delete signage at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
4889  return;
4890  }
4891 
4892  current_submap->delete_signage( l );
4893 }
4894 void map::delete_signage( const tripoint_bub_ms &p )
4895 {
4896  delete_signage( p.raw() );
4897 }
4898 
4899 int map::get_radiation( const tripoint &p ) const
4900 {
4901  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4902  return 0;
4903  }
4904 
4905  point l;
4906  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
4907  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
4908  debugmsg( "Tried to get radiation at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
4909  return 0;
4910  }
4911 
4912  return current_submap->get_radiation( l );
4913 }
4914 
4915 void map::set_radiation( const tripoint &p, const int value )
4916 {
4917  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4918  return;
4919  }
4920 
4921  point l;
4922  submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
