7232  } else {
7233  // otherwise override with the symbol of the last item
7234  item_sym = curr_maptile.get_uppermost_item().symbol();
7235  if( !draw_item_sym ) {
7236  tercol = curr_maptile.get_uppermost_item().color();
7237  }
7238  if( curr_maptile.get_item_count() > 1 ) {
7239  param.highlight( !param.highlight() );
7240  }
7241  }
7242  }
7243 
7244  int veh_part = 0;
7245  const vehicle *veh = veh_at_internal( p, veh_part );
7246  if( veh != nullptr ) {
7247  const vpart_display vd = veh->get_display_of_tile( veh->part( veh_part ).mount );
7248  sym = vd.symbol_curses;
7249  tercol = vd.color;
7250  item_sym.clear(); // clear the item symbol so `sym` is used instead.
7251 
7252  if( !veh->forward_velocity() && !veh->player_in_control( player_character )
7253  && !( player_character.get_grab_type() == object_type::VEHICLE
7254  && veh->get_points().count( player_character.pos() + player_character.grab_point ) ) ) {
7255  memory_sym = sym;
7256  }
7257  }
7258 
7259  if( param.memorize() && memory_cache_ter_is_dirty( p ) ) {
7260  player_character.memorize_symbol( getglobal( p ), memory_sym );
7261  memory_cache_ter_set_dirty( p, false );
7262  }
7263 
7264  // If there's graffiti here, change background color
7265  if( curr_maptile.has_graffiti() ) {
7266  graf = true;
7267  }
7268 
7269  const auto u_vision = player_character.get_vision_modes();
7270  if( u_vision[BOOMERED] ) {
7271  tercol = c_magenta;
7272  } else if( u_vision[NV_GOGGLES] ) {
7273  tercol = param.bright_light() ? c_white : c_light_green;
7274  } else if( param.low_light() || u_vision[DARKNESS] ) {
7275  tercol = c_dark_gray;
7276  }
7277 
7278  if( param.highlight() ) {
7279  tercol = invert_color( tercol );
7280  } else if( hi ) {
7281  tercol = hilite( tercol );
7282  } else if( graf ) {
7283  tercol = red_background( tercol );
7284  }
7285 
7286  if( item_sym.empty() && sym == ' ' ) {
7287  if( !zlevels || p.z <= -OVERMAP_DEPTH || !curr_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR ) ) {
7288  // Print filler symbol
7289  tercol = c_black;
7290  } else {
7291  // Draw tile underneath this one instead
7292  return false;
7293  }
7294  }
7295 
7296  if( params.output() ) {
7297  if( item_sym.empty() ) {
7298  wputch( w, tercol, sym );
7299  } else {
7300  wprintz( w, tercol, item_sym );
7301  }
7302  }
7303  return true;
7304 }
7305 
7306 void map::draw_from_above( const catacurses::window &w, const tripoint &p,
7307  const const_maptile &curr_tile, const drawsq_params &params ) const
7308 {
7309  static const int AUTO_WALL_PLACEHOLDER = 2; // this should never appear as a real symbol!
7310 
7311  nc_color tercol = c_dark_gray;
7312  int sym = ' ';
7313 
7314  const ter_t &curr_ter = curr_tile.get_ter_t();
7315  const furn_t &curr_furn = curr_tile.get_furn_t();
7316  int part_below;
7317  const vehicle *veh;
7318  if( curr_furn.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEEN_FROM_ABOVE ) ) {
7319  sym = curr_furn.symbol();
7320  tercol = curr_furn.color();
7321  } else if( curr_furn.movecost < 0 ) {
7322  sym = '.';
7323  tercol = curr_furn.color();
7324  } else if( ( veh = veh_at_internal( p, part_below ) ) != nullptr ) {
7325  const vpart_position vpp( const_cast<vehicle &>( *veh ), part_below );
7326  const vpart_display vd = veh->get_display_of_tile( vpp.mount(), true, true, false );
7327  const int roof = veh->roof_at_part( part_below );
7328  sym = vd.symbol_curses;
7329  tercol = roof >= 0 || vpp.obstacle_at_part() ? c_light_gray : c_light_gray_cyan;
7330  } else if( curr_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEEN_FROM_ABOVE ) ) {
7331  if( curr_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_AUTO_WALL_SYMBOL ) ) {
7332  sym = AUTO_WALL_PLACEHOLDER;
7333  } else if( curr_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_RAMP ) ) {
7334  sym = '>';
7335  } else {
7336  sym = curr_ter.symbol();
7337  }
7338  tercol = curr_ter.color();
7339  } else if( curr_ter.movecost == 0 ) {
7340  sym = '.';
7341  tercol = curr_ter.color();
7342  } else if( !curr_ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_NO_FLOOR ) ) {
7343  sym = '.';
7344  if( curr_ter.color() != c_cyan ) {
7345  // Need a special case here, it doesn't cyanize well
7346  tercol = cyan_background( curr_ter.color() );
7347  } else {
7348  tercol = c_black_cyan;
7349  }
7350  } else {
7351  sym = curr_ter.symbol();
7352  tercol = curr_ter.color();
7353  }
7354 
7355  if( sym == AUTO_WALL_PLACEHOLDER ) {
7356  sym = determine_wall_corner( p );
7357  }
7358 
7359  const std::bitset<NUM_VISION_MODES> &u_vision = get_player_character().get_vision_modes();
7360  if( u_vision[BOOMERED] ) {
7361  tercol = c_magenta;
7362  } else if( u_vision[NV_GOGGLES] ) {
7363  tercol = params.bright_light() ? c_white : c_light_green;
7364  } else if( params.low_light() || u_vision[DARKNESS] ) {
7365  tercol = c_dark_gray;
7366  }
7367 
7368  if( params.highlight() ) {
7369  tercol = invert_color( tercol );
7370  }
7371 
7372  if( params.output() ) {
7373  wputch( w, tercol, sym );
7374  }
7375 }
7376 
7377 bool map::sees( const tripoint &F, const tripoint &T, const int range, bool with_fields ) const
7378 {
7379  int dummy = 0;
7380  return sees( F, T, range, dummy, with_fields );
7381 }
7382 
7383 point map::sees_cache_key( const tripoint &from, const tripoint &to ) const
7384 {
7385 
7386  // Canonicalize the order of the tripoints so the cache is reflexive.
7387  const tripoint &min = from < to ? from : to;
7388  const tripoint &max = !( from < to ) ? from : to;
7389 
7390  // A little gross, just pack the values into a point.
7391  return point(
7392  min.x << 16 | min.y << 8 | ( min.z + OVERMAP_DEPTH ),
7393  max.x << 16 | max.y << 8 | ( max.z + OVERMAP_DEPTH )
7394  );
7395 }
7396 
7397 /**
7398  * This one is internal-only, we don't want to expose the slope tweaking ickiness outside the map class.
7399  **/
7400 bool map::sees( const tripoint &F, const tripoint &T, const int range,
7401  int &bresenham_slope, bool with_fields ) const
7402 {
7403  bool ( map::*f_transparent )( const tripoint & p ) const =
7404  with_fields ? &map::is_transparent : &map::is_transparent_wo_fields;
7405  lru_cache_t &skew_cache = with_fields ? skew_vision_cache : skew_vision_wo_fields_cache;
7406  if( std::abs( F.z - T.z ) > fov_3d_z_range ||
7407  ( range >= 0 && range < rl_dist( F, T ) ) ||
7408  !inbounds( T ) ) {
7409  bresenham_slope = 0;
7410  return false; // Out of range!
7411  }
7412  const point key = sees_cache_key( F, T );
7413  char cached = skew_cache.get( key, -1 );
7414  if( cached >= 0 ) {
7415  return cached > 0;
7416  }
7417  bool visible = true;
7418 
7419  // Ugly `if` for now
7420  if( F.z == T.z ) {
7421  bresenham( F.xy(), T.xy(), bresenham_slope,
7422  [this, f_transparent, &visible, &T]( const point & new_point ) {
7423  // Exit before checking the last square, it's still visible even if opaque.
7424  if( new_point.x == T.x && new_point.y == T.y ) {
7425  return false;
7426  }
7427  if( !( this->*f_transparent )( tripoint( new_point, T.z ) ) ) {
7428  visible = false;
7429  return false;
7430  }
7431  return true;
7432  } );
7433  skew_cache.insert( 100000, key, visible ? 1 : 0 );
7434  return visible;
7435  }
7436 
7437  tripoint last_point = F;
7438  bresenham( F, T, bresenham_slope, 0,
7439  [this, f_transparent, &visible, &T, &last_point]( const tripoint & new_point ) {
7440  // Exit before checking the last square if it's not a vertical transition,
7441  // it's still visible even if opaque.
7442  if( new_point == T && last_point.z == T.z ) {
7443  return false;
7444  }
7445 
7446  // TODO: Allow transparent floors (and cache them!)
7447  if( new_point.z == last_point.z ) {
7448  if( !( this->*f_transparent )( new_point ) ) {
7449  visible = false;
7450  return false;
7451  }
7452  } else {
7453  const int max_z = std::max( new_point.z, last_point.z );
7454  if( ( has_floor_or_support( {new_point.xy(), max_z} ) ||
7455  !( this->*f_transparent )( {new_point.xy(), last_point.z} ) ) &&
7456  ( has_floor_or_support( {last_point.xy(), max_z} ) ||
7457  !( this->*f_transparent )( {last_point.xy(), new_point.z} ) ) ) {
7458  visible = false;
7459  return false;
7460  }
7461  }
7462 
7463  last_point = new_point;
7464  return true;
7465  } );
7466  skew_cache.insert( 100000, key, visible ? 1 : 0 );
7467  return visible;
7468 }
7469 
7470 int map::obstacle_coverage( const tripoint &loc1, const tripoint &loc2 ) const
7471 {
7472  // Can't hide if you are standing on furniture, or non-flat slowing-down terrain tile.
7473  if( furn( loc2 ).obj().id || ( move_cost( loc2 ) > 2 &&
7474  !has_flag_ter( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FLAT, loc2 ) ) ) {
7475  return 0;
7476  }
7477  const point a( std::abs( loc1.x - loc2.x ) * 2, std::abs( loc1.y - loc2.y ) * 2 );
7478  int offset = std::min( a.x, a.y ) - ( std::max( a.x, a.y ) / 2 );
7479  tripoint obstaclepos;
7480  bresenham( loc2, loc1, offset, 0, [&obstaclepos]( const tripoint & new_point ) {
7481  // Only adjacent tile between you and enemy is checked for cover.
7482  obstaclepos = new_point;
7483  return false;
7484  } );
7485  if( const furn_id obstacle_f = furn( obstaclepos ) ) {
7486  return obstacle_f->coverage;
7487  }
7488  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( obstaclepos ) ) {
7489  if( vp->obstacle_at_part() ) {
7490  return 60;
7491  } else if( !vp->part_with_feature( VPFLAG_AISLE, true ) ) {
7492  return 45;
7493  }
7494  }
7495  return ter( obstaclepos )->coverage;
7496 }
7497 
7498 int map::ledge_coverage( const Creature &viewer, const tripoint &target_p ) const
7499 {
7500  tripoint viewer_p = viewer.pos();
7501  creature_size viewer_size = viewer.get_size();
7502 
7503  // Viewer eye level from ground in grids
7504  float eye_level = 1.0f;
7505  switch( viewer_size ) {
7506  case creature_size::medium:
7507  break;
7508  case creature_size::tiny:
7509  eye_level = 0.4f;
7510  break;
7511  case creature_size::small:
7512  eye_level = 0.7f;
7513  break;
7514  case creature_size::large:
7515  eye_level = 1.3f;
7516  break;
7517  case creature_size::huge:
7518  eye_level = 1.6f;
7519  break;
7520  case creature_size::num_sizes:
7521  debugmsg( "ERROR: Creature has invalid size class." );
7522  break;
7523  }
7524  // Viewer eye level crouch / prone multipliers
7525  const Character *viewer_ch = viewer.as_character();
7526  if( viewer_ch ) {
7527  if( viewer_ch->is_crouching() ) {
7528  eye_level *= 0.5;
7529  } else if( viewer_ch->is_prone() ) {
7530  eye_level *= 0.275;
7531  }
7532  }
7533  // Viewer eye level is higher when standing on furniture
7534  const furn_id viewer_furn = furn( viewer_p );
7535  if( viewer_furn.obj().id ) {
7536  eye_level += viewer_furn->coverage * 0.01f;
7537  }
7538 
7539  return ledge_coverage( viewer_p, target_p, eye_level );
7540 }
7541 
7542 int map::ledge_coverage( const tripoint &viewer_p, const tripoint &target_p,
7543  const float &eye_level ) const
7544 {
7545  if( viewer_p.z == target_p.z ) {
7546  return 0;
7547  }
7548 
7549  // Find ledge between viewer and target
7550  // Only the first ledge found is calculated for performance reasons
7551  tripoint high_p;
7552  tripoint low_p;
7553  if( viewer_p.z > target_p.z ) {
7554  high_p = viewer_p;
7555  low_p = target_p;
7556  } else {
7557  high_p = target_p;
7558  low_p = viewer_p;
7559  }
7560  tripoint ledge_p = high_p;
7561  bresenham( tripoint( low_p.xy(), high_p.z ), high_p, 0, 0, [this,
7562  &ledge_p]( const tripoint & new_point ) {
7563  if( dont_draw_lower_floor( new_point ) ) {
7564  ledge_p = new_point;
7565  return false;
7566  }
7567  return true;
7568  } );
7569 
7570  // Height of each z-level in grids
7571  const float zlevel_to_grid_ratio = 2.0f;
7572  float dist_to_ledge_base = trig_dist( viewer_p, tripoint( ledge_p.xy(), viewer_p.z ) );
7573  // Adjustment to ledge distance because ledge is assumed to be between two grids
7574  dist_to_ledge_base += ( viewer_p.z < target_p.z ) ? -0.5f : 0.5f;
7575  const float flat_dist = trig_dist( viewer_p, tripoint( target_p.xy(), viewer_p.z ) );
7576  // Absolute level of viewer's eye
7577  const float abs_eye_z = viewer_p.z * zlevel_to_grid_ratio + eye_level;
7578  // "Opposite" of the angle between the eye level and ledge
7579  const float eye_ledge_z_delta = ( ledge_p.z * zlevel_to_grid_ratio ) - abs_eye_z;
7580  const float tangent = eye_ledge_z_delta / dist_to_ledge_base;
7581  // Absolute level concealed by ledge, anything below this point is invisible
7582  const float covered_z = abs_eye_z + ( tangent * flat_dist );
7583  // Ledge coverage given by comparing covered_z and the absolute z of the target space
7584  float ledge_coverage = ( covered_z - target_p.z * zlevel_to_grid_ratio ) * 100;
7585 
7586  // Early exit if the tile is definitely not covered
7587  if( ledge_coverage < 0 ) {
7588  return 0;
7589  }
7590  // Target has a coverage penalty when standing on furniture
7591  const furn_id target_furn = furn( target_p );
7592  if( target_furn ) {
7593  ledge_coverage -= target_furn->coverage;
7594  }
7595 
7596  return std::max( ledge_coverage, 0.0f );
7597 }
7598 
7599 int map::coverage( const tripoint &p ) const
7600 {
7601  if( const furn_id obstacle_f = furn( p ) ) {
7602  return obstacle_f->coverage;
7603  }
7604  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = veh_at( p ) ) {
7605  if( vp->obstacle_at_part() ) {
7606  return 60;
7607  } else if( !vp->part_with_feature( VPFLAG_AISLE, true ) ) {
7608  return 45;
7609  }
7610  }
7611  return ter( p )->coverage;
7612 }
7613 
7614 // This method tries a bunch of initial offsets for the line to try and find a clear one.
7615 // Basically it does, "Find a line from any point in the source that ends up in the target square".
7616 std::vector<tripoint> map::find_clear_path( const tripoint &source,
7617  const tripoint &destination ) const
7618 {
7619  // TODO: Push this junk down into the Bresenham method, it's already doing it.
7620  const point d( destination.xy() - source.xy() );
7621  const point a( std::abs( d.x ) * 2, std::abs( d.y ) * 2 );
7622  const int dominant = std::max( a.x, a.y );
7623  const int minor = std::min( a.x, a.y );
7624  // This seems to be the method for finding the ideal start value for the error value.
7625  const int ideal_start_offset = minor - dominant / 2;
7626  const int start_sign = ( ideal_start_offset > 0 ) - ( ideal_start_offset < 0 );
7627  // Not totally sure of the derivation.
7628  const int max_start_offset = std::abs( ideal_start_offset ) * 2 + 1;
7629  for( int horizontal_offset = -1; horizontal_offset <= max_start_offset; ++horizontal_offset ) {
7630  int candidate_offset = horizontal_offset * start_sign;
7631  if( sees( source, destination, rl_dist( source, destination ), candidate_offset ) ) {
7632  return line_to( source, destination, candidate_offset, 0 );
7633  }
7634  }
7635  // If we couldn't find a clear LoS, just return the ideal one.
7636  return line_to( source, destination, ideal_start_offset, 0 );
7637 }
7638 
7639 void map::reachable_flood_steps( std::vector<tripoint> &reachable_pts, const tripoint &f,
7640  int range, const int cost_min, const int cost_max ) const
7641 {
7642  struct pq_item {
7643  int dist;
7644  int ndx;
7645  };
7646  struct pq_item_comp {
7647  bool operator()( const pq_item &left, const pq_item &right ) {
7648  return left.dist > right.dist;
7649  }
7650  };
7651  using PQ_type = std::priority_queue< pq_item, std::vector<pq_item>, pq_item_comp>;
7652 
7653  // temp buffer for grid
7654  const int grid_dim = range * 2 + 1;
7655  // init to -1 as "not visited yet"
7656  std::vector< int > t_grid( static_cast<size_t>( grid_dim * grid_dim ), -1 );
7657  const tripoint origin_offset = {range, range, 0};
7658  const int initial_visit_distance = range * range; // Large unreachable value
7659 
7660  // Fill positions that are visitable with initial_visit_distance
7661  for( const tripoint &p : points_in_radius( f, range ) ) {
7662  const tripoint tp = { p.xy(), f.z };
7663  const int tp_cost = move_cost( tp );
7664  // rejection conditions
7665  if( tp_cost < cost_min || tp_cost > cost_max || is_open_air( tp ) ) {
7666  continue;
7667  }
7668  // set initial cost for grid point
7669  tripoint origin_relative = tp - f;
7670  origin_relative += origin_offset;
7671  int ndx = origin_relative.x + origin_relative.y * grid_dim;
7672  t_grid[ ndx ] = initial_visit_distance;
7673  }
7674 
7675  auto gen_neighbors = []( const pq_item & elem, int grid_dim, std::array<pq_item, 8> &neighbors ) {
7676  // Up to 8 neighbors
7677  int new_cost = elem.dist + 1;
7678  // *INDENT-OFF*
7679  std::array<int, 8> ox = {
7680  -1, 0, 1,
7681  -1, 1,
7682  -1, 0, 1
7683  };
7684  std::array<int, 8> oy = {
7685  -1, -1, -1,
7686  0, 0,
7687  1, 1, 1
7688  };
7689  // *INDENT-ON*
7690 
7691  point e( elem.ndx % grid_dim, elem.ndx / grid_dim );
7692  for( int i = 0; i < 8; ++i ) {
7693  point n( e + point( ox[i], oy[i] ) );
7694 
7695  int ndx = n.x + n.y * grid_dim;
7696  neighbors[i] = { new_cost, ndx };
7697  }
7698  };
7699 
7700  PQ_type pq( pq_item_comp{} );
7701  pq_item first_item{ 0, range + range * grid_dim };
7702  pq.push( first_item );
7703  std::array<pq_item, 8> neighbor_elems;
7704 
7705  while( !pq.empty() ) {
7706  const pq_item item = pq.top();
7707  pq.pop();
7708 
7709  if( t_grid[ item.ndx ] == initial_visit_distance ) {
7710  t_grid[ item.ndx ] = item.dist;
7711  if( item.dist + 1 < range ) {
7712  gen_neighbors( item, grid_dim, neighbor_elems );
7713  for( pq_item neighbor_elem : neighbor_elems ) {
7714  pq.push( neighbor_elem );
7715  }
7716  }
7717  }
7718  }
7719  std::vector<char> o_grid( static_cast<size_t>( grid_dim * grid_dim ), 0 );
7720  for( int y = 0, ndx = 0; y < grid_dim; ++y ) {
7721  for( int x = 0; x < grid_dim; ++x, ++ndx ) {
7722  if( t_grid[ ndx ] != -1 && t_grid[ ndx ] < initial_visit_distance ) {
7723  // set self and neighbors to 1
7724  for( int dy = -1; dy <= 1; ++dy ) {
7725  for( int dx = -1; dx <= 1; ++dx ) {
7726  point t2( dx + x, dy + y );
7727 
7728  if( t2.x >= 0 && t2.x < grid_dim && t2.y >= 0 && t2.y < grid_dim ) {
7729  o_grid[ t2.x + t2.y * grid_dim ] = 1;
7730  }
7731  }
7732  }
7733  }
7734  }
7735  }
7736 
7737  // Now go over again to pull out all of the reachable points
7738  for( int y = 0, ndx = 0; y < grid_dim; ++y ) {
7739  for( int x = 0; x < grid_dim; ++x, ++ndx ) {
7740  if( o_grid[ ndx ] ) {
7741  tripoint t = f - origin_offset + tripoint{ x, y, 0 };
7742  reachable_pts.push_back( t );
7743  }
7744  }
7745  }
7746 }
7747 
7748 bool map::clear_path( const tripoint &f, const tripoint &t, const int range,
7749  const int cost_min, const int cost_max ) const
7750 {
7751  if( std::abs( f.z - t.z ) > fov_3d_z_range ) {
7752  return false;
7753  }
7754 
7755  // Ugly `if` for now
7756  if( f.z == t.z ) {
7757  if( ( range >= 0 && range < rl_dist( f.xy(), t.xy() ) ) ||
7758  !inbounds( t ) ) {
7759  return false; // Out of range!
7760  }
7761  bool is_clear = true;
7762  bresenham( f.xy(), t.xy(), 0,
7763  [this, &is_clear, cost_min, cost_max, &t]( const point & new_point ) {
7764  // Exit before checking the last square, it's still reachable even if it is an obstacle.
7765  if( new_point.x == t.x && new_point.y == t.y ) {
7766  return false;
7767  }
7768 
7769  const int cost = this->move_cost( new_point );
7770  if( cost < cost_min || cost > cost_max ) {
7771  is_clear = false;
7772  return false;
7773  }
7774  return true;
7775  } );
7776  return is_clear;
7777  }
7778 
7779  if( ( range >= 0 && range < rl_dist( f, t ) ) ||
7780  !inbounds( t ) ) {
7781  return false; // Out of range!
7782  }
7783  bool is_clear = true;
7784  tripoint last_point = f;
7785  bresenham( f, t, 0, 0,
7786  [this, &is_clear, cost_min, cost_max, t, &last_point]( const tripoint & new_point ) {
7787  // Exit before checking the last square, it's still reachable even if it is an obstacle.
7788  if( new_point == t ) {
7789  return false;
7790  }
7791 
7792  // We have to check a weird case where the move is both vertical and horizontal
7793  if( new_point.z == last_point.z ) {
7794  const int cost = move_cost( new_point );
7795  if( cost < cost_min || cost > cost_max ) {
7796  is_clear = false;
7797  return false;
7798  }
7799  } else {
7800  bool this_clear = false;
7801  const int max_z = std::max( new_point.z, last_point.z );
7802  if( !has_floor_or_support( {new_point.xy(), max_z} ) ) {
7803  const int cost = move_cost( {new_point.xy(), last_point.z} );
7804  if( cost > cost_min && cost < cost_max ) {
7805  this_clear = true;
7806  }
7807  }
7808 
7809  if( !this_clear && has_floor_or_support( {last_point.xy(), max_z} ) ) {
7810  const int cost = move_cost( {last_point.xy(), new_point.z} );
7811  if( cost > cost_min && cost < cost_max ) {
7812  this_clear = true;
7813  }
7814  }
7815 
7816  if( !this_clear ) {
7817  is_clear = false;
7818  return false;
7819  }
7820  }
7821 
7822  last_point = new_point;
7823  return true;
7824  } );
7825  return is_clear;
7826 }
7827 
7828 bool map::clear_path( const tripoint_bub_ms &f, const tripoint_bub_ms &t, const int range,
7829  const int cost_min, const int cost_max ) const
7830 {
7831  return clear_path( f.raw(), t.raw(), range, cost_min, cost_max );
7832 }
7833 
7834 bool map::accessible_items( const tripoint &t ) const
7835 {
7836  return !has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SEALED, t ) ||
7837  has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_LIQUIDCONT, t );
7838 }
7839 
7840 bool map::accessible_items( const tripoint_bub_ms &t ) const
7841 {
7842  return accessible_items( t.raw() );
7843 }
7844 
7845 std::vector<tripoint> map::get_dir_circle( const tripoint &f, const tripoint &t ) const
7846 {
7847  std::vector<tripoint> circle;
7848  circle.resize( 8 );
7849 
7850  // The line below can be crazy expensive - we only take the FIRST point of it
7851  const std::vector<tripoint> line = line_to( f, t, 0, 0 );
7852  const std::vector<tripoint> spiral = closest_points_first( f, 1 );
7853  const std::vector<int> pos_index {1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 7, 5, 3};
7854 
7855  // All possible constellations (closest_points_first goes clockwise)
7856  // 753 531 312 124 246 468 687 875
7857  // 8 1 7 2 5 4 3 6 1 8 2 7 4 5 6 3
7858  // 642 864 786 578 357 135 213 421
7859 
7860  size_t pos_offset = 0;
7861  for( size_t i = 1; i < spiral.size(); i++ ) {
7862  if( spiral[i] == line[0] ) {
7863  pos_offset = i - 1;
7864  break;
7865  }
7866  }
7867 
7868  for( size_t i = 1; i < spiral.size(); i++ ) {
7869  if( pos_offset >= pos_index.size() ) {
7870  pos_offset = 0;
7871  }
7872 
7873  circle[pos_index[pos_offset++] - 1] = spiral[i];
7874  }
7875 
7876  return circle;
7877 }
7878 
7879 void map::save()
7880 {
7881  for( int gridx = 0; gridx < my_MAPSIZE; gridx++ ) {
7882  for( int gridy = 0; gridy < my_MAPSIZE; gridy++ ) {
7883  if( zlevels ) {
7884  for( int gridz = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; gridz <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT; gridz++ ) {
7885  saven( tripoint( gridx, gridy, gridz ) );
7886  }
7887  } else {
7888  saven( tripoint( gridx, gridy, abs_sub.z() ) );
7889  }
7890  }
7891  }
7892 }
7893 
7894 void map::load( const tripoint_abs_sm &w, const bool update_vehicle,
7895  const bool pump_events )
7896 {
7897  map &main_map = get_map();
7898  // It used to be unsafe to load a map that overlaps with the primary map;
7899  // Show an info line in tests to help track new errors
7900  if( test_mode && this != &main_map && main_map.inbounds( project_to<coords::ms>( w ) ) ) {
7901  DebugLog( D_INFO, DC_ALL )
7902  << "loading non-main map at " << w.to_string()
7903  << " which overlaps with main map (abs_sub = " << main_map.abs_sub.to_string() << ")";
7904  }
7905  for( auto &traps : traplocs ) {
7906  traps.clear();
7907  }
7908  field_furn_locs.clear();
7909  field_ter_locs.clear();
7910  submaps_with_active_items.clear();
7911  submaps_with_active_items_dirty.clear();
7912  set_abs_sub( w );
7913  clear_vehicle_level_caches();
7914  for( int gridx = 0; gridx < my_MAPSIZE; gridx++ ) {
7915  for( int gridy = 0; gridy < my_MAPSIZE; gridy++ ) {
7916  loadn( point( gridx, gridy ), update_vehicle );
7917  if( pump_events ) {
7918  inp_mngr.pump_events();
7919  }
7920  }
7921  }
7922  rebuild_vehicle_level_caches();
7923 
7924  // actualize after loading all submaps to prevent errors
7925  // with entities at the edges
7926  for( int gridx = 0; gridx < my_MAPSIZE; gridx++ ) {
7927  for( int gridy = 0; gridy < my_MAPSIZE; gridy++ ) {
7928  const int zmin = zlevels ? -OVERMAP_DEPTH : abs_sub.z();
7929  const int zmax = zlevels ? OVERMAP_HEIGHT : abs_sub.z();
7930  for( int gridz = zmin; gridz <= zmax; gridz++ ) {
7931  actualize( tripoint( point( gridx, gridy ), gridz ) );
7932  if( pump_events ) {
7933  inp_mngr.pump_events();
7934  }
7935  }
7936  }
7937  }
7938 }
7939 
7940 void map::shift_traps( const tripoint &shift )
7941 {
7942  // Offset needs to have sign opposite to shift direction
7943  const tripoint offset( -shift.x * SEEX, -shift.y * SEEY, -shift.z );
7944  for( auto iter = field_furn_locs.begin(); iter != field_furn_locs.end(); ) {
7945  tripoint &pos = *iter;
7946  pos += offset;
7947  if( inbounds( pos ) ) {
7948  ++iter;
7949  } else {
7950  iter = field_furn_locs.erase( iter );
7951  }
7952  }
7953  for( auto iter = field_ter_locs.begin(); iter != field_ter_locs.end(); ) {
7954  tripoint &pos = *iter;
7955  pos += offset;
7956  if( inbounds( pos ) ) {
7957  ++iter;
7958  } else {
7959  iter = field_ter_locs.erase( iter );
7960  }
7961  }
7962  for( auto &traps : traplocs ) {
7963  for( auto iter = traps.begin(); iter != traps.end(); ) {
7964  tripoint &pos = *iter;
7965  pos += offset;
7966  if( inbounds( pos ) ) {
7967  ++iter;
7968  } else {
7969  // Theoretical enhancement: if this is not the last entry of the vector,
7970  // move the last entry into pos and remove the last entry instead of iter.
7971  // This would avoid moving all the remaining entries.
7972  iter = traps.erase( iter );
7973  }
7974  }
7975  }
7976 }
7977 
7978 template<int SIZE, int MULTIPLIER>
7979 void shift_bitset_cache( std::bitset<SIZE *SIZE> &cache, const point &s )
7980 {
7981  // sx shifts by MULTIPLIER rows, sy shifts by MULTIPLIER columns.
7982  int shift_amount = s.x * MULTIPLIER + s.y * SIZE * MULTIPLIER;
7983  if( shift_amount > 0 ) {
7984  cache >>= static_cast<size_t>( shift_amount );
7985  } else if( shift_amount < 0 ) {
7986  cache <<= static_cast<size_t>( -shift_amount );
7987  }
7988  // Shifting in the y direction shifted in 0 values, no no additional clearing is necessary, but
7989  // a shift in the x direction makes values "wrap" to the next row, and they need to be zeroed.
7990  if( s.x == 0 ) {
7991  return;
7992  }
7993  const size_t x_offset = s.x > 0 ? SIZE - MULTIPLIER : 0;
7994  for( size_t y = 0; y < SIZE; ++y ) {
7995  size_t y_offset = y * SIZE;
7996  for( size_t x = 0; x < MULTIPLIER; ++x ) {
7997  cache.reset( y_offset + x_offset + x );
7998  }
7999  }
8000 }
8001 
8002 template void
8003 shift_bitset_cache<MAPSIZE_X, SEEX>( std::bitset<MAPSIZE_X *MAPSIZE_X> &cache,
8004  const point &s );
8005 template void
8006 shift_bitset_cache<MAPSIZE, 1>( std::bitset<MAPSIZE *MAPSIZE> &cache, const point &s );
8007 
8008 void map::shift( const point &sp )
8009 {
8010  if( !zlevels ) {
8011  debugmsg( "map::shift called from map that doesn't support Z levels" );
8012  return;
8013  }
8014 
8015  // Special case of 0-shift; refresh the map
8016  if( sp == point_zero ) {
8017  return; // Skip this?
8018  }
8019 
8020  if( std::abs( sp.x ) > 1 || std::abs( sp.y ) > 1 ) {
8021  debugmsg( "map::shift called with a shift of more than one submap" );
8022  return;
8023  }
8024 
8025  const tripoint_abs_sm abs = get_abs_sub();
8026  std::vector<tripoint> loaded_grids;
8027 
8028  // TODO: fix point types (sp should be relative?)
8029  set_abs_sub( abs + sp );
8030 
8031  g->shift_destination_preview( point( -sp.x * SEEX, -sp.y * SEEY ) );
8032 
8033  shift_traps( tripoint( sp, 0 ) );
8034 
8035  vehicle *remoteveh = g->remoteveh();
8036 
8037  const int zmin = -OVERMAP_DEPTH;
8038  const int zmax = OVERMAP_HEIGHT;
8039 
8040  for( int gridz = zmin; gridz <= zmax; gridz++ ) {
8041  level_cache *cache = get_cache_lazy( gridz );
8042  if( !cache ) {
8043  continue;
8044  }
8045  for( vehicle *veh : cache->vehicle_list ) {
8046  veh->zones_dirty = true;
8047  }
8048  }
8049 
8050  // Shift the map sx submaps to the right and sy submaps down.
8051  // sx and sy should never be bigger than +/-1.
8052  // absx and absy are our position in the world, for saving/loading purposes.
8053  clear_vehicle_level_caches();
8054 
8055  const int x_start = sp.x >= 0 ? 0 : my_MAPSIZE - 1;
8056  const int x_stop = sp.x >= 0 ? my_MAPSIZE : -1;
8057  const int x_step = sp.x >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
8058  const int y_start = sp.y >= 0 ? 0 : my_MAPSIZE - 1;
8059  const int y_stop = sp.y >= 0 ? my_MAPSIZE : -1;
8060  const int y_step = sp.y >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
8061 
8062  for( int gridz = zmin; gridz <= zmax; gridz++ ) {
8063  // Clear vehicle list and rebuild after shift
8064  // mlangsdorf 2020 - this is kind of insane, building the cache is not free, why are
8065  // we doing this?
8066  clear_vehicle_list( gridz );
8067  level_cache *cache = get_cache_lazy( gridz );
8068  if( cache ) {
8069  shift_bitset_cache<MAPSIZE_X, SEEX>( cache->map_memory_cache_dec, sp );
8070  shift_bitset_cache<MAPSIZE_X, SEEX>( cache->map_memory_cache_ter, sp );
8071  shift_bitset_cache<MAPSIZE, 1>( cache->field_cache, sp );
8072  }
8073  }
8074 
8075  for( int gridx = x_start; gridx != x_stop; gridx += x_step ) {
8076  for( int gridy = y_start; gridy != y_stop; gridy += y_step ) {
8077  if( gridx + sp.x != x_stop && gridy + sp.y != y_stop ) {
8078  for( int gridz = zmin; gridz <= zmax; gridz++ ) {
8079  const tripoint grid( gridx, gridy, gridz );
8080 
8081  copy_grid( grid, grid + sp );
8082  submap *const cur_submap = get_submap_at_grid( grid );
8083  if( cur_submap == nullptr ) {
8084  debugmsg( "Tried to update vehicle list at %s but the submap is not loaded", grid.to_string() );
8085  continue;
8086  }
8087  update_vehicle_list( cur_submap, gridz );
8088  }
8089  } else {
8090  loadn( point( gridx, gridy ), true );
8091 
8092  for( int gridz = zmin; gridz <= zmax; gridz++ ) {
8093  loaded_grids.emplace_back( gridx, gridy, gridz );
8094  }
8095  }
8096  }
8097  }
8098 
8099  rebuild_vehicle_level_caches();
8100 
8101  g->setremoteveh( remoteveh );
8102 
8103  if( !support_cache_dirty.empty() ) {
8104  std::set<tripoint> old_cache = std::move( support_cache_dirty );
8105  support_cache_dirty.clear();
8106  for( const tripoint &pt : old_cache ) {
8107  support_cache_dirty.insert( pt + point( -sp.x * SEEX, -sp.y * SEEY ) );
8108  }
8109  }
8110  // actualize after loading all submaps to prevent errors
8111  // with entities at the edges
8112  for( tripoint loaded_grid : loaded_grids ) {
8113  actualize( loaded_grid );
8114  }
8115 }
8116 
8117 void map::vertical_shift( const int newz )
8118 {
8119  if( !zlevels ) {
8120  debugmsg( "Called map::vertical_shift in a non-z-level world" );
8121  return;
8122  }
8123 
8124  if( newz < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || newz > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
8125  debugmsg( "Tried to get z-level %d outside allowed range of %d-%d",
8126  newz, -OVERMAP_DEPTH, OVERMAP_HEIGHT );
8127  return;
8128  }
8129 
8130  tripoint_abs_sm trp = get_abs_sub();
8131  set_abs_sub( tripoint_abs_sm( trp.xy(), newz ) );
8132 
8133  // TODO: Remove the function when it's safe
8134 }
8135 
8136 // saven saves a single nonant. worldx and worldy are used for the file
8137 // name and specifies where in the world this nonant is. gridx and gridy are
8138 // the offset from the top left nonant:
8139 // 0,0 1,0 2,0
8140 // 0,1 1,1 2,1
8141 // 0,2 1,2 2,2
8142 // (worldx,worldy,worldz) denotes the absolute coordinate of the submap
8143 // in grid[0].
8144 void map::saven( const tripoint &grid )
8145 {
8146  dbg( D_INFO ) << "map::saven(worldx[" << abs_sub.x() << "], worldy[" << abs_sub.y()
8147  << "], worldz[" << abs_sub.z()
8148  << "], gridx[" << grid.x << "], gridy[" << grid.y << "], gridz[" << grid.z << "])";
8149  const int gridn = get_nonant( grid );
8150  submap *submap_to_save = getsubmap( gridn );
8151  if( submap_to_save == nullptr ) {
8152  debugmsg( "Tried to save submap node (%d) but it's not loaded", gridn );
8153  return;
8154  }
8155  if( submap_to_save->get_ter( point_zero ) == ter_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
8156  // This is a serious error and should be signaled as soon as possible
8157  debugmsg( "map::saven grid %s uninitialized!", grid.to_string() );
8158  return;
8159  }
8160 
8161  const tripoint_abs_sm abs = abs_sub.xy() + grid;
8162 
8163  if( !zlevels && grid.z != abs_sub.z() ) {
8164  debugmsg( "Tried to save submap (%d,%d,%d) as (%d,%d,%d), which isn't supported in non-z-level builds",
8165  abs.x(), abs.y(), abs_sub.z(), abs.x(), abs.y(), grid.z );
8166  }
8167 
8168  dbg( D_INFO ) << "map::saven abs: " << abs
8169  << " gridn: " << gridn;
8170  submap_to_save->last_touched = calendar::turn;
8171  MAPBUFFER.add_submap( abs, submap_to_save );
8172 }
8173 
8174 // Optimized mapgen function that only works properly for very simple overmap types
8175 // Does not create or require a temporary map and does its own saving
8176 bool generate_uniform( const tripoint_abs_sm &p, const oter_id &oter )
8177 {
8178  std::unique_ptr<submap> sm = std::make_unique<submap>();
8179  if( oter == oter_open_air ) {
8180  sm->set_all_ter( ter_t_open_air, true );
8181  } else if( oter == oter_empty_rock || oter == oter_deep_rock ) {
8182  sm->set_all_ter( ter_t_rock, true );
8183  } else if( oter == oter_solid_earth ) {
8184  sm->set_all_ter( ter_t_soil, true );
8185  } else {
8186  return false;
8187  }
8188  sm->last_touched = calendar::turn;
8189  return MAPBUFFER.add_submap( p, sm );
8190 }
8191 
8192 bool generate_uniform_omt( const tripoint_abs_sm &p, const oter_id &terrain_type )
8193 {
8194  dbg( D_INFO ) << "generate_uniform p: " << p
8195  << " terrain_type: " << terrain_type.id().str();
8196 
8197  bool ret = true;
8198  for( int xd = 0; xd <= 1; xd++ ) {
8199  for( int yd = 0; yd <= 1; yd++ ) {
8200  ret &= generate_uniform( p + point( xd, yd ), terrain_type );
8201  }
8202  }
8203  return ret;
8204 }
8205 
8206 void map::loadn( const tripoint &grid, const bool update_vehicles )
8207 {
8208  dbg( D_INFO ) << "map::loadn(game[" << g.get() << "], worldx[" << abs_sub.x()
8209  << "], worldy[" << abs_sub.y() << "], grid " << grid << ")";
8210 
8211  const tripoint_abs_sm grid_abs_sub = abs_sub.xy() + grid;
8212  const size_t gridn = get_nonant( grid );
8213 
8214  dbg( D_INFO ) << "map::loadn grid_abs_sub: " << grid_abs_sub << " gridn: " << gridn;
8215 
8216  const int old_abs_z = abs_sub.z(); // Ugly, but necessary at the moment
8217  abs_sub.z() = grid.z;
8218 
8219  bool const main_inbounds =
8220  this != &get_map() && get_map().inbounds( project_to<coords::ms>( grid_abs_sub ) );
8221 
8222  submap *tmpsub = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( grid_abs_sub );
8223  if( tmpsub == nullptr ) {
8224  // It doesn't exist; we must generate it!
8225  dbg( D_INFO | D_WARNING ) << "map::loadn: Missing mapbuffer data. Regenerating.";
8226 
8227  // Each overmap square is two nonants; to prevent overlap, generate only at
8228  // squares divisible by 2.
8229  const tripoint_abs_omt grid_abs_omt = project_to<coords::omt>( grid_abs_sub );
8230  const tripoint_abs_sm grid_abs_sub_rounded = project_to<coords::sm>( grid_abs_omt );
8231 
8232  const oter_id terrain_type = overmap_buffer.ter( grid_abs_omt );
8233 
8234  // Short-circuit if the map tile is uniform
8235  // TODO: Replace with json mapgen functions.
8236  if( !generate_uniform_omt( grid_abs_sub_rounded, terrain_type ) ) {
8237  tinymap tmp_map;
8238  tmp_map.main_cleanup_override( false );
8239  tmp_map.generate( grid_abs_omt, calendar::turn );
8240  _main_requires_cleanup |= main_inbounds && tmp_map.is_main_cleanup_queued();
8241  }
8242 
8243  // This is the same call to MAPBUFFER as above!
8244  tmpsub = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( grid_abs_sub );
8245  if( tmpsub == nullptr ) {
8246  dbg( D_ERROR ) << "failed to generate a submap at " << grid_abs_sub;
8247  debugmsg( "failed to generate a submap at %s", grid_abs_sub.to_string() );
8248  return;
8249  }
8250  }
8251 
8252  // New submap changes the content of the map and all caches must be recalculated
8253  set_transparency_cache_dirty( grid.z );
8254  set_seen_cache_dirty( grid.z );
8255  set_outside_cache_dirty( grid.z );
8256  set_floor_cache_dirty( grid.z );
8257  set_pathfinding_cache_dirty( grid.z );
8258  setsubmap( gridn, tmpsub );
8259  if( !tmpsub->active_items.empty() ) {
8260  submaps_with_active_items_dirty.emplace( grid_abs_sub );
8261  }
8262  if( tmpsub->field_count > 0 ) {
8263  get_cache( grid.z ).field_cache.set( grid.x + grid.y * MAPSIZE );
8264  }
8265 
8266  // Destroy bugged no-part vehicles
8267  auto &veh_vec = tmpsub->vehicles;
8268  for( auto iter = veh_vec.begin(); iter != veh_vec.end(); ) {
8269  vehicle *veh = iter->get();
8270  if( veh->part_count() > 0 ) {
8271  // Always fix submap coordinates for easier Z-level-related operations
8272  veh->sm_pos = grid;
8273  iter++;
8274  if( main_inbounds ) {
8275  _main_requires_cleanup = true;
8276  }
8277  } else {
8278  if( veh->tracking_on ) {
8279  overmap_buffer.remove_vehicle( veh );
8280  }
8281  dirty_vehicle_list.erase( veh );
8282  iter = veh_vec.erase( iter );
8283  }
8284  }
8285 
8286  // Update vehicle data
8287  if( update_vehicles ) {
8288  level_cache &map_cache = get_cache( grid.z );
8289  for( const auto &veh : tmpsub->vehicles ) {
8290  // Only add if not tracking already.
8291  if( map_cache.vehicle_list.find( veh.get() ) == map_cache.vehicle_list.end() ) {
8292  map_cache.vehicle_list.insert( veh.get() );
8293  if( !veh->loot_zones.empty() ) {
8294  map_cache.zone_vehicles.insert( veh.get() );
8295  }
8296  }
8297  }
8298  }
8299 
8300  abs_sub.z() = old_abs_z;
8301 }
8302 
8303 void map::loadn( const point &grid, bool update_vehicles )
8304 {
8305  if( zlevels ) {
8306  for( int gridz = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; gridz <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT; gridz++ ) {
8307  loadn( tripoint( grid, gridz ), update_vehicles );
8308  }
8309 
8310  // Note: we want it in a separate loop! It is a post-load cleanup
8311  // Since we're adding roofs, we want it to go up (from lowest to highest)
8312  for( int gridz = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; gridz <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT; gridz++ ) {
8313  add_roofs( tripoint( grid, gridz ) );
8314  }
8315  } else {
8316  loadn( tripoint( grid, abs_sub.z() ), update_vehicles );
8317  }
8318 }
8319 
8320 void map::rotten_item_spawn( const item &item, const tripoint &pnt )
8321 {
8322  if( get_creature_tracker().creature_at( pnt ) != nullptr ) {
8323  return;
8324  }
8325  const auto &comest = item.get_comestible();
8326  mongroup_id mgroup = comest->rot_spawn;
8327  if( mgroup.is_null() ) {
8328  return;
8329  }
8330 
8331  if( rng( 0, 100 ) < comest->rot_spawn_chance ) {
8332  std::vector<MonsterGroupResult> spawn_details = MonsterGroupManager::GetResultFromGroup( mgroup );
8333  for( const MonsterGroupResult &mgr : spawn_details ) {
8334  add_spawn( mgr, tripoint_bub_ms( pnt ) );
8335  }
8336  if( get_player_view().sees( pnt ) ) {
8337  if( item.is_seed() ) {
8338  add_msg( m_warning, _( "Something has crawled out of the %s plants!" ), item.get_plant_name() );
8339  } else {
8340  add_msg( m_warning, _( "Something has crawled out of the %s!" ), item.tname() );
8341  }
8342  }
8343  }
8344 }
8345 
8346 void map::fill_funnels( const tripoint &p, const time_point &since )
8347 {
8348  const trap &tr = tr_at( p );
8349  if( !tr.is_funnel() ) {
8350  return;
8351  }
8352  // Note: the inside/outside cache might not be correct at this time
8353  if( has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS, p ) ) {
8354  return;
8355  }
8356  map_stack items = i_at( p );
8357  units::volume maxvolume = 0_ml;
8358  auto biggest_container = items.end();
8359  for( auto candidate = items.begin(); candidate != items.end(); ++candidate ) {
8360  if( candidate->is_funnel_container( maxvolume ) ) {
8361  biggest_container = candidate;
8362  }
8363  }
8364  if( biggest_container != items.end() ) {
8365  retroactively_fill_from_funnel( *biggest_container, tr, since, calendar::turn, getglobal( p ) );
8366  }
8367 }
8368 
8369 void map::grow_plant( const tripoint &p )
8370 {
8371  const furn_t &furn = this->furn( p ).obj();
8372  if( !furn.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_PLANT ) ) {
8373  return;
8374  }
8375  // Can't use item_stack::only_item() since there might be fertilizer
8376  map_stack items = i_at( p );
8377  map_stack::iterator seed = std::find_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
8378  return it.is_seed();
8379  } );
8380 
8381  if( seed == items.end() ) {
8382  // No seed there anymore, we don't know what kind of plant it was.
8383  // TODO: Fix point types
8384  const tripoint_abs_ms ms_pos( getabs( p ) );
8385  const tripoint_abs_sm sm_pos = project_to<coords::sm>( ms_pos );
8386  const oter_id ot = overmap_buffer.ter( project_to<coords::omt>( ms_pos ) );
8387  dbg( D_ERROR ) << "plant furniture has no seed item. "
8388  << "furniture: " << furn.id.str()
8389  << ", submap absolute: " << sm_pos
8390  << ", map square absolute: " << ms_pos
8391  << ", class map map square relative: " << p
8392  << ", overmap terrain: " << ot.id().str()
8393  << ", other items: " << enumerate_as_string( items, []( const item & it ) {
8394  return it.display_name();
8395  } );
8396  i_clear( p );
8397  furn_set( p, furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
8398  return;
8399  }
8400  // TODO: this should probably be read from the seed's data. But for now, everything uses exactly this many growth stages.
8401  std::map<ter_furn_flag, int> plant_epochs;
8402  plant_epochs[ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GROWTH_SEEDLING] = 1;
8403  plant_epochs[ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GROWTH_MATURE] = 2;
8404  plant_epochs[ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_GROWTH_HARVEST] = 3;
8405 
8406  const time_duration base_epoch_duration = seed->get_plant_epoch( plant_epochs.size() );
8407  const time_duration epoch_duration = base_epoch_duration * furn.plant->growth_multiplier;
8408  if( seed->age() >= epoch_duration ) {
8409  const int epoch_age = seed->age() / epoch_duration;
8410  int current_epoch = 0;
8411  for( std::pair<const ter_furn_flag, int> pair : plant_epochs ) {
8412  if( has_flag_furn( pair.first, p ) ) {
8413  current_epoch = pair.second;
8414  break;
8415  }
8416  }
8417  const int epochs_to_advance = epoch_age - current_epoch;
8418 
8419  for( int i = 0; i < epochs_to_advance; i++ ) {
8420  // Remove fertilizer if any
8421  map_stack::iterator fertilizer = std::find_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
8422  return it.has_flag( flag_FERTILIZER );
8423  } );
8424  if( fertilizer != items.end() ) {
8425  items.erase( fertilizer );
8426  }
8427  // spawn appropriate amount of rot_spawn, equivalent to number of times we iterate this loop
8428  rotten_item_spawn( *seed, p );
8429  // Get an updated reference to the furniture each time we go through this loop, to make sure we transform each step in turn
8430  const furn_t &current_furn = this->furn( p ).obj();
8431  furn_set( p, furn_str_id( current_furn.plant->transform ) );
8432  }
8433 
8434  }
8435 }
8436 
8437 void map::restock_fruits( const tripoint &p, const time_duration &time_since_last_actualize )
8438 {
8439  const ter_t &ter = this->ter( p ).obj();
8440  if( !ter.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_HARVESTED ) ) {
8441  return; // Already harvestable. Do nothing.
8442  }
8443  // Make it harvestable again if the last actualization was during a different season or year.
8444  const time_point last_touched = calendar::turn - time_since_last_actualize;
8445  if( season_of_year( calendar::turn ) != season_of_year( last_touched ) ||
8446  time_since_last_actualize >= calendar::season_length() ) {
8447  ter_set( p, ter.transforms_into );
8448  }
8449 }
8450 
8451 void map::produce_sap( const tripoint &p, const time_duration &time_since_last_actualize )
8452 {
8453  if( time_since_last_actualize <= 0_turns ) {
8454  return;
8455  }
8456 
8457  if( !( ter( p ) == ter_t_tree_maple_tapped ) ) {
8458  return;
8459  }
8460 
8461  // Amount of maple sap liters produced per season per tap
8462  static const int maple_sap_per_season = 56;
8463 
8464  // How many turns to produce 1 charge (250 ml) of sap?
8465  const time_duration producing_length = 0.75 * calendar::season_length();
8466 
8467  const time_duration turns_to_produce = producing_length / ( maple_sap_per_season * 4 );
8468 
8469  // How long of this time_since_last_actualize have we been in the producing period (late winter, early spring)?
8470  time_duration time_producing = 0_turns;
8471 
8472  if( time_since_last_actualize >= calendar::year_length() ) {
8473  time_producing = producing_length;
8474  } else {
8475  // We are only producing sap on the intersection with the sap producing season.
8476  const time_duration early_spring_end = 0.5f * calendar::season_length();
8477  const time_duration late_winter_start = 3.75f * calendar::season_length();
8478 
8479  const time_point last_actualize = calendar::turn - time_since_last_actualize;
8480  const time_duration last_actualize_tof = time_past_new_year( last_actualize );
8481  bool last_producing = last_actualize_tof >= late_winter_start ||
8482  last_actualize_tof < early_spring_end;
8483  const time_duration current_tof = time_past_new_year( calendar::turn );
8484  bool current_producing = current_tof >= late_winter_start ||
8485  current_tof < early_spring_end;
8486 
8487  const time_duration non_producing_length = 3.25 * calendar::season_length();
8488 
8489  if( last_producing && current_producing ) {
8490  if( time_since_last_actualize < non_producing_length ) {
8491  time_producing = time_since_last_actualize;
8492  } else {
8493  time_producing = time_since_last_actualize - non_producing_length;
8494  }
8495  } else if( !last_producing && !current_producing ) {
8496  if( time_since_last_actualize > non_producing_length ) {
8497  time_producing = time_since_last_actualize - non_producing_length;
8498  }
8499  } else if( last_producing && !current_producing ) {
8500  // We hit the end of early spring
8501  if( last_actualize_tof < early_spring_end ) {
8502  time_producing = early_spring_end - last_actualize_tof;
8503  } else {
8504  time_producing = calendar::year_length() - last_actualize_tof + early_spring_end;
8505  }
8506  } else if( !last_producing && current_producing ) {
8507  // We hit the start of late winter
8508  if( current_tof >= late_winter_start ) {
8509  time_producing = current_tof - late_winter_start;
8510  } else {
8511  time_producing = 0.25f * calendar::season_length() + current_tof;
8512  }
8513  }
8514  }
8515 
8516  int new_charges = roll_remainder( time_producing / turns_to_produce );
8517  // Not enough time to produce 1 charge of sap
8518  if( new_charges <= 0 ) {
8519  return;
8520  }
8521 
8522  item sap( "maple_sap", calendar::turn );
8523 
8524  sap.set_item_temperature( get_weather().get_temperature( p ) );
8525  sap.charges = new_charges;
8526 
8527  // Is there a proper container?
8528  map_stack items = i_at( p );
8529  for( item &it : items ) {
8530  if( it.will_spill() || it.is_watertight_container() ) {
8531  const int capacity = it.get_remaining_capacity_for_liquid( sap, true );
8532  if( capacity > 0 ) {
8533  sap.charges = std::min( sap.charges, capacity );
8534 
8535  // The environment might have poisoned the sap with animals passing by, insects, leaves or contaminants in the ground
8536  sap.poison = one_in( 10 ) ? 1 : 0;
8537 
8538  it.put_in( sap, pocket_type::CONTAINER );
8539  }
8540  // Only fill up the first container.
8541  break;
8542  }
8543  }
8544 }
8545 
8546 void map::cut_down_tree( tripoint_bub_ms p, point dir )
8547 {
8548  if( !zlevels ) {
8549  debugmsg( "Call to cut_down_tree from a map that doesn't support zlevels." );
8550  return;
8551  }
8552 
8553  if( !ter( p ).obj().has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_TREE ) ) {
8554  debugmsg( "Call to cut_down_tree on a tile that doesn't contain a tree." );
8555  return;
8556  }
8557 
8558  tripoint_bub_ms to = p + 3 * dir + point( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) );
8559 
8560  // TODO: make line_to type aware.
8561  std::vector<tripoint> tree = line_to( p.raw(), to.raw(), rng( 1, 8 ) );
8562  for( tripoint &elem : tree ) {
8563  batter( elem, 300, 5 );
8564  ter_set( elem, ter_t_trunk );
8565  }
8566  ter_set( p, ter_t_stump );
8567 }
8568 
8569 void map::rad_scorch( const tripoint &p, const time_duration &time_since_last_actualize )
8570 {
8571  const int rads = get_radiation( p );
8572  if( rads == 0 ) {
8573  return;
8574  }
8575 
8576  // TODO: More interesting rad scorch chance - base on season length?
8577  if( !x_in_y( 1.0 * rads * rads * time_since_last_actualize, 91_days ) ) {
8578  return;
8579  }
8580 
8581  // First destroy the farmable plants (those are furniture)
8582  // TODO: Rad-resistant mutant plants (that produce radioactive fruit)
8583  const furn_t &fid = furn( p ).obj();
8584  if( fid.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_PLANT ) ) {
8585  i_clear( p );
8586  furn_set( p, furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
8587  }
8588 
8589  const ter_id tid = ter( p );
8590  // TODO: De-hardcode this
8591  static const std::map<ter_id, ter_str_id> dies_into {{
8592  {ter_t_grass, ter_t_dirt},
8593  {ter_t_tree_young, ter_t_dirt},
8594  {ter_t_tree_pine, ter_t_tree_deadpine},
8595  {ter_t_tree_birch, ter_t_tree_birch_harvested},
8596  {ter_t_tree_willow, ter_t_tree_willow_harvested},
8597  {ter_t_tree_hickory, ter_t_tree_hickory_dead},
8598  {ter_t_tree_hickory_harvested, ter_t_tree_hickory_dead},
8599  }};
8600 
8601  const auto iter = dies_into.find( tid );
8602  if( iter != dies_into.end() ) {
8603  ter_set( p, iter->second );
8604  return;
8605  }
8606 
8607  const ter_t &tr = tid.obj();
8608  if( tr.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SHRUB ) ) {
8609  ter_set( p, ter_t_dirt );
8610  } else if( tr.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_TREE ) ) {
8611  ter_set( p, ter_t_tree_dead );
8612  }
8613 }
8614 
8615 void map::decay_cosmetic_fields( const tripoint &p,
8616  const time_duration &time_since_last_actualize )
8617 {
8618  for( auto &pr : field_at( p ) ) {
8619  field_entry &fd = pr.second;
8620  const time_duration hl = fd.get_field_type().obj().half_life;
8621  if( !fd.get_field_type()->accelerated_decay || hl <= 0_turns ) {
8622  continue;
8623  }
8624 
8625  const time_duration added_age = 2 * time_since_last_actualize / rng( 2, 4 );
8626  fd.mod_field_age( added_age );
8627  const int intensity_drop = fd.get_field_age() / hl;
8628  if( intensity_drop > 0 ) {
8629  fd.set_field_intensity( fd.get_field_intensity() - intensity_drop );
8630  fd.mod_field_age( -hl * intensity_drop );
8631  }
8632  }
8633 }
8634 
8635 void map::actualize( const tripoint &grid )
8636 {
8637  submap *const tmpsub = get_submap_at_grid( grid );
8638  if( tmpsub == nullptr ) {
8639  debugmsg( "Actualize called on null submap (%d,%d,%d)", grid.x, grid.y, grid.z );
8640  return;
8641  }
8642 
8643  for( const std::unique_ptr<vehicle> &veh : tmpsub->vehicles ) {
8644  // spill out items too large, MIGRATION pockets etc from vehicle parts
8645  for( const vpart_reference &vp : veh->get_all_parts() ) {
8646  const item &base_const = vp.part().get_base();
8647  const_cast<item &>( base_const ).overflow( vp.pos() );
8648  }
8649  veh->refresh();
8650  }
8651 
8652  const time_duration time_since_last_actualize = calendar::turn - tmpsub->last_touched;
8653  const bool do_funnels = grid.z >= 0;
8654 
8655  // check spoiled stuff, and fill up funnels while we're at it
8656  process_items_in_vehicles( *tmpsub );
8657  process_items_in_submap( *tmpsub, grid );
8658  explosion_handler::process_explosions();
8659  for( int x = 0; x < SEEX; x++ ) {
8660  for( int y = 0; y < SEEY; y++ ) {
8661  const tripoint pnt = sm_to_ms_copy( grid ) + point( x, y );
8662  const point p( x, y );
8663  const furn_t &furn = *this->furn( pnt );
8664  const ter_t &terr = *this->ter( pnt );
8665  if( !furn.emissions.empty() ) {
8666  field_furn_locs.push_back( pnt );
8667  }
8668  if( !terr.emissions.empty() ) {
8669  field_ter_locs.push_back( pnt );
8670  }
8671 
8672  const trap_id trap_here = tmpsub->get_trap( p );
8673  if( trap_here != tr_null ) {
8674  traplocs[trap_here.to_i()].push_back( pnt );
8675  }
8676  const ter_t &ter = tmpsub->get_ter( p ).obj();
8677  if( ter.trap != tr_null && ter.trap != tr_ledge ) {
8678  traplocs[ter.trap.to_i()].push_back( pnt );
8679  }
8680 
8681  if( do_funnels ) {
8682  fill_funnels( pnt, tmpsub->last_touched );
8683  }
8684 
8685  grow_plant( pnt );
8686 
8687  restock_fruits( pnt, time_since_last_actualize );
8688 
8689  produce_sap( pnt, time_since_last_actualize );
8690 
8691  rad_scorch( pnt, time_since_last_actualize );
8692 
8693  decay_cosmetic_fields( pnt, time_since_last_actualize );
8694  }
8695  }
8696 
8697  // the last time we touched the submap, is right now.
8698  tmpsub->last_touched = calendar::turn;
8699 }
8700 
8701 void map::add_roofs( const tripoint &grid )
8702 {
8703  if( !zlevels ) {
8704  // No roofs required!
8705  // Why not? Because submaps below and above don't exist yet
8706  return;
8707  }
8708 
8709  submap *const sub_here = get_submap_at_grid( grid );
8710  if( sub_here == nullptr ) {
8711  debugmsg( "Tried to add roofs/floors on null submap on %d,%d,%d",
8712  grid.x, grid.y, grid.z );
8713  return;
8714  }
8715 
8716  bool check_roof = grid.z > -OVERMAP_DEPTH;
8717 
8718  submap *const sub_below = check_roof ? get_submap_at_grid( grid + tripoint_below ) : nullptr;
8719 
8720  if( check_roof && sub_below == nullptr ) {
8721  debugmsg( "Tried to add roofs to sm at %d,%d,%d, but sm below doesn't exist",
8722  grid.x, grid.y, grid.z );
8723  return;
8724  }
8725 
8726  for( int x = 0; x < SEEX; x++ ) {
8727  for( int y = 0; y < SEEY; y++ ) {
8728  const ter_id ter_here = sub_here->get_ter( { x, y } );
8729  if( ter_here.id() != ter_t_open_air ) {
8730  continue;
8731  }
8732 
8733  if( !check_roof ) {
8734  // Make sure we don't have open air at lowest z-level
8735  sub_here->set_ter( { x, y }, ter_t_rock_floor );
8736  continue;
8737  }
8738 
8739  const ter_t &ter_below = sub_below->get_ter( { x, y } ).obj();
8740  if( ter_below.roof ) {
8741  // TODO: Make roof variable a ter_id to speed this up
8742  sub_here->set_ter( { x, y }, ter_below.roof.id() );
8743  }
8744  }
8745  }
8746 }
8747 
8748 void map::copy_grid( const tripoint &to, const tripoint &from )
8749 {
8750  submap *smap = get_submap_at_grid( from );
8751  if( smap == nullptr ) {
8752  debugmsg( "Tried to copy grid from (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", from.x, from.y,
8753  from.z );
8754  return;
8755  }
8756  setsubmap( get_nonant( to ), smap );
8757  for( auto &it : smap->vehicles ) {
8758  it->sm_pos = to;
8759  }
8760 }
8761 
8762 void map::spawn_monsters_submap_group( const tripoint &gp, mongroup &group, bool ignore_sight )
8763 {
8764  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
8765  const int s_range = std::min( HALF_MAPSIZE_X,
8766  player_character.sight_range( g->light_level( player_character.posz() ) ) );
8767  int pop = group.population;
8768  std::vector<tripoint> locations;
8769  if( !ignore_sight ) {
8770  // If the submap is one of the outermost submaps, assume that monsters are
8771  // invisible there.
8772  if( gp.x == 0 || gp.y == 0 || gp.x + 1 == MAPSIZE || gp.y + 1 == MAPSIZE ) {
8773  ignore_sight = true;
8774  }
8775  }
8776 
8777  if( gp.z != player_character.posz() ) {
8778  // Note: this is only OK because 3D vision isn't a thing yet
8779  ignore_sight = true;
8780  }
8781 
8782  static const auto allow_on_terrain = [&]( const tripoint & p ) {
8783  // TODO: flying creatures should be allowed to spawn without a floor,
8784  // but the new creature is created *after* determining the terrain, so
8785  // we can't check for it here.
8786  return passable( p ) && has_floor_or_water( p );
8787  };
8788 
8789  // If the submap is uniform, we can skip many checks
8790  const submap *current_submap = get_submap_at_grid( gp );
8791  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
8792  debugmsg( "Tried spawn monster group at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", gp.x, gp.y,
8793  gp.z );
8794  return;
8795  }
8796  bool ignore_terrain_checks = false;
8797  bool ignore_inside_checks = gp.z < 0;
8798  if( current_submap->is_uniform() ) {
8799  const tripoint upper_left{ SEEX * gp.x, SEEY * gp.y, gp.z };
8800  if( !allow_on_terrain( upper_left ) ||
8801  ( !ignore_inside_checks && has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS, upper_left ) ) ) {
8802  const tripoint glp = getabs( gp );
8803  dbg( D_WARNING ) << "Empty locations for group " << group.type.str() <<
8804  " at uniform submap " << gp.x << "," << gp.y << "," << gp.z <<
8805  " global " << glp.x << "," << glp.y << "," << glp.z;
8806  return;
8807  }
8808 
8809  ignore_terrain_checks = true;
8810  ignore_inside_checks = true;
8811  }
8812 
8813  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
8814  for( int x = 0; x < SEEX; ++x ) {
8815  for( int y = 0; y < SEEY; ++y ) {
8816  point f( x + SEEX * gp.x, y + SEEY * gp.y );
8817  tripoint fp{ f, gp.z };
8818  if( creatures.creature_at( fp ) != nullptr ) {
8819  continue; // there is already some creature
8820  }
8821 
8822  if( !ignore_terrain_checks && !allow_on_terrain( fp ) ) {
8823  continue; // solid area, impassable
8824  }
8825 
8826  if( !ignore_sight && sees( player_character.pos(), fp, s_range ) ) {
8827  continue; // monster must spawn outside the viewing range of the player
8828  }
8829 
8830  if( !ignore_inside_checks && has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS, fp ) ) {
8831  continue; // monster must spawn outside.
8832  }
8833 
8834  locations.push_back( fp );
8835  }
8836  }
8837 
8838  if( locations.empty() ) {
8839  // TODO: what now? there is no possible place to spawn monsters, most
8840  // likely because the player can see all the places.
8841  const tripoint glp = getabs( gp );
8842  dbg( D_WARNING ) << "Empty locations for group " << group.type.str() <<
8843  " at " << gp.x << "," << gp.y << "," << gp.z <<
8844  " global " << glp.x << "," << glp.y << "," << glp.z;
8845  // Just kill the group. It's not like we're removing existing monsters
8846  // Unless it's a horde - then don't kill it and let it spawn behind a tree or smoke cloud
8847  if( !group.horde ) {
8848  group.clear();
8849  }
8850 
8851  return;
8852  }
8853 
8854  if( pop ) {
8855  // Populate the group from its population variable.
8856  for( int m = 0; m < pop; m++ ) {
8857  std::vector<MonsterGroupResult> spawn_details =
8858  MonsterGroupManager::GetResultFromGroup( group.type, &pop );
8859  for( const MonsterGroupResult &mgr : spawn_details ) {
8860  if( !mgr.name ) {
8861  continue;
8862  }
8863  monster tmp( mgr.name );
8864 
8865  // If a monster came from a horde population, configure them to always be willing to rejoin a horde.
8866  if( group.horde ) {
8867  tmp.set_horde_attraction( MHA_ALWAYS );
8868  }
8869  for( int i = 0; i < mgr.pack_size; i++ ) {
8870  group.monsters.push_back( tmp );
8871  }
8872  }
8873  }
8874  }
8875 
8876  // Find horde's target submap
8877  for( monster &tmp : group.monsters ) {
8878  for( int tries = 0; tries < 10 && !locations.empty(); tries++ ) {
8879  const tripoint local_pos = random_entry_removed( locations );
8880  const tripoint_abs_ms abs_pos = get_map().getglobal( local_pos );
8881  if( !tmp.can_move_to( local_pos ) ) {
8882  continue; // target can not contain the monster
8883  }
8884  if( group.horde ) {
8885  // Give monster a random point near horde's expected destination
8886  const tripoint_sm_ms pos_in_sm( rng( 0, SEEX ), rng( 0, SEEY ), local_pos.z );
8887  const tripoint_abs_ms rand_dest = project_combine( group.target, pos_in_sm );
8888  const int turns = rl_dist( abs_pos, rand_dest ) + group.interest;
8889  tmp.wander_to( rand_dest, turns );
8890  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_MAP, "%s targeting %s", tmp.disp_name(),
8891  tmp.wander_pos.to_string_writable() );
8892  }
8893 
8894  monster *const placed = g->place_critter_at( make_shared_fast<monster>( tmp ), local_pos );
8895  if( placed ) {
8896  placed->on_load();
8897  }
8898  break;
8899  }
8900  }
8901  // indicates the group is empty, and can be removed later
8902  group.clear();
8903 }
8904 
8905 void map::spawn_monsters_submap( const tripoint &gp, bool ignore_sight, bool spawn_nonlocal )
8906 {
8907  // TODO: fix point types
8908  const tripoint_abs_sm submap_pos( gp + abs_sub.xy() );
8909  // Load unloaded monsters
8910  overmap_buffer.spawn_monster( submap_pos, spawn_nonlocal );
8911  // Only spawn new monsters after existing monsters are loaded.
8912  std::vector<mongroup *> groups = overmap_buffer.groups_at( submap_pos );
8913  for( mongroup *&mgp : groups ) {
8914  spawn_monsters_submap_group( gp, *mgp, ignore_sight );
8915  }
8916 
8917  submap *const current_submap = get_submap_at_grid( gp );
8918  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
8919  debugmsg( "Tried spawn monsters at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", gp.x, gp.y, gp.z );
8920  return;
8921  }
8922  const tripoint gp_ms = sm_to_ms_copy( gp );
8923 
8924  creature_tracker &creatures = get_creature_tracker();
8925 
8926  // The list of spawns on the submap might be updated while we are iterating it.
8927  // For example, `monster::on_load` -> `monster::try_reproduce` calls `map::add_spawn`.
8928  // Therefore, this intentionally uses old-school indexed for-loop with re-check against `.size()` each step.
8929  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(modernize-loop-convert)
8930  for( size_t sp_i = 0; sp_i < current_submap->spawns.size(); ++sp_i ) {
8931  const spawn_point i = current_submap->spawns[sp_i]; // intentional copy
8932  const tripoint center = gp_ms + i.pos;
8933  const tripoint_range<tripoint> points = points_in_radius( center, 3 );
8934 
8935  for( int j = 0; j < i.count; j++ ) {
8936  monster tmp( i.type );
8937 
8938  if( tmp.type->in_species( species_FERAL ) ) {
8939  if( one_in( 100 ) ) {
8940  // Same chances and duration of flu vs. cold as for the player.
8941  if( one_in( 6 ) ) {
8942  tmp.add_effect( effect_fake_flu, rng( 3_days, 10_days ) );
8943  } else {
8944  tmp.add_effect( effect_fake_common_cold, rng( 1_days, 14_days ) );
8945  }
8946  }
8947  }
8948 
8949  if( i.mission_id > 0 ) {
8950  mission *found_mission = mission::find( i.mission_id );
8951  if( found_mission != nullptr ) {
8952  tmp.mission_ids = { i.mission_id };
8953  if( found_mission->get_type().goal == MGOAL_KILL_MONSTERS ) {
8954  found_mission->register_kill_needed();
8955  }
8956  }
8957  }
8958  if( i.name.has_value() ) {
8959  tmp.unique_name = i.name.value();
8960  }
8961  if( i.friendly ) {
8962  tmp.friendly = -1;
8963  tmp.add_effect( effect_pet, 1_turns, true );
8964  }
8965  if( !i.data.ammo.empty() ) {
8966  for( std::pair<itype_id, jmapgen_int> ap : i.data.ammo ) {
8967  tmp.ammo.emplace( ap.first, ap.second.get() );
8968  }
8969  } else {
8970  tmp.ammo = tmp.type->starting_ammo;
8971  }
8972 
8973  const auto valid_location = [&]( const tripoint & p ) {
8974  // Checking for creatures via g is only meaningful if this is the main game map.
8975  // If it's some local map instance, the coordinates will most likely not even match.
8976  return ( !g || &get_map() != this || !creatures.creature_at( p ) ) && tmp.can_move_to( p );
8977  };
8978 
8979  const auto place_it = [&]( const tripoint & p ) {
8980  monster *const placed = g->place_critter_at( make_shared_fast<monster>( tmp ), p );
8981  if( !i.data.patrol_points_rel_ms.empty() ) {
8982  placed->set_patrol_route( i.data.patrol_points_rel_ms );
8983  }
8984  if( placed ) {
8985  placed->on_load();
8986  }
8987  };
8988 
8989  // First check out defined spawn location for a valid placement, and if that doesn't work
8990  // then fall back to picking a random point that is a valid location.
8991  if( valid_location( center ) ) {
8992  place_it( center );
8993  } else if( const std::optional<tripoint> pos = random_point( points, valid_location ) ) {
8994  place_it( *pos );
8995  }
8996  }
8997  }
8998  current_submap->spawns.clear();
8999 }
9000 
9001 void map::spawn_monsters( bool ignore_sight, bool spawn_nonlocal )
9002 {
9003  const int zmin = zlevels ? -OVERMAP_DEPTH : abs_sub.z();
9004  const int zmax = zlevels ? OVERMAP_HEIGHT : abs_sub.z();
9005  tripoint gp;
9006  int &gx = gp.x;
9007  int &gy = gp.y;
9008  int &gz = gp.z;
9009  for( gz = zmin; gz <= zmax; gz++ ) {
9010  for( gx = 0; gx < my_MAPSIZE; gx++ ) {
9011  for( gy = 0; gy < my_MAPSIZE; gy++ ) {
9012  spawn_monsters_submap( gp, ignore_sight, spawn_nonlocal );
9013  }
9014  }
9015  }
9016 }
9017 
9018 void map::clear_spawns()
9019 {
9020  for( submap *&smap : grid ) {
9021  smap->spawns.clear();
9022  }
9023 }
9024 
9025 void map::clear_traps()
9026 {
9027  for( submap *&smap : grid ) {
9028  for( int x = 0; x < SEEX; x++ ) {
9029  for( int y = 0; y < SEEY; y++ ) {
9030  const point p( x, y );
9031  smap->set_trap( p, tr_null );
9032  }
9033  }
9034  }
9035 
9036  // Forget about all trap locations.
9037  for( auto &i : traplocs ) {
9038  i.clear();
9039  }
9040 }
9041 
9042 const std::vector<tripoint> &map::get_furn_field_locations() const
9043 {
9044  return field_furn_locs;
9045 }
9046 
9047 const std::vector<tripoint> &map::get_ter_field_locations() const
9048 {
9049  return field_ter_locs;
9050 }
9051 
9052 const std::vector<tripoint> &map::trap_locations( const trap_id &type ) const
9053 {
9054  return traplocs[type.to_i()];
9055 }
9056 
9057 bool map::inbounds( const tripoint &p ) const
9058 {
9059  return p.x >= 0 && p.x < my_MAPSIZE * SEEX &&
9060  p.y >= 0 && p.y < my_MAPSIZE * SEEY &&
9061  p.z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH && p.z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT;
9062  // && ( zlevels || p.z == get_abs_sub().z() );
9063  // Cannot actually let inbounds check the bounds for maps not supporting Z levels, as
9064  // tests explicitly expect other Z level coordinates to return t_null when read
9065  // and write terrain to the Z level of the map rather than fail or do nothing.
9066 }
9067 
9068 bool map::inbounds( const tripoint_abs_ms &p ) const
9069 {
9070  return inbounds( getlocal( p ) );
9071 }
9072 
9073 bool map::inbounds( const tripoint_bub_ms &p ) const
9074 {
9075  return inbounds( p.raw() );
9076 }
9077 
9078 bool map::inbounds( const tripoint_abs_omt &p ) const
9079 {
9080  const tripoint_abs_omt map_origin = project_to<coords::omt>( abs_sub );
9081  return p.z() >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH && p.z() <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT &&
9082  ( zlevels || p.z() == get_abs_sub().z() ) &&
9083  p.x() >= map_origin.x() &&
9084  p.y() >= map_origin.y() &&
9085  p.x() <= map_origin.x() + my_HALF_MAPSIZE &&
9086  p.y() <= map_origin.y() + my_HALF_MAPSIZE;
9087 }
9088 
9089 tripoint_range<tripoint> tinymap::points_on_zlevel() const
9090 {
9091  return map::points_on_zlevel();
9092 }
9093 
9094 tripoint_range<tripoint> tinymap::points_on_zlevel( int z ) const
9095 {
9096  return map::points_on_zlevel( z );
9097 }
9098 
9099 tripoint_range<tripoint> tinymap::points_in_rectangle(
9100  const tripoint &from, const tripoint &to ) const
9101 {
9102  return map::points_in_rectangle( from, to );
9103 }
9104 
9105 tripoint_range<tripoint_omt_ms> tinymap::points_in_rectangle(
9106  const tripoint_omt_ms &from, const tripoint_omt_ms &to ) const
9107 {
9108  const tripoint_range<tripoint> preliminary_result = map::points_in_rectangle( from.raw(),
9109  to.raw() );
9110  return tripoint_range<tripoint_omt_ms>( tripoint_omt_ms( preliminary_result.min() ),
9111  tripoint_omt_ms( preliminary_result.max() ) );
9112 }
9113 
9114 tripoint_range<tripoint> tinymap::points_in_radius(
9115  const tripoint &center, size_t radius, size_t radiusz ) const
9116 {
9117  return map::points_in_radius( center, radius, radiusz );
9118 }
9119 
9120 tripoint_range<tripoint_omt_ms> tinymap::points_in_radius(
9121  const tripoint_omt_ms &center, size_t radius, size_t radiusz ) const
9122 {
9123  const tripoint_range<tripoint> preliminary_result = map::points_in_radius( center.raw(), radius,
9124  radiusz );
9125  return tripoint_range<tripoint_omt_ms>( tripoint_omt_ms( preliminary_result.min() ),
9126  tripoint_omt_ms( preliminary_result.max() ) );
9127 }
9128 
9129 // set up a map just long enough scribble on it
9130 // this tinymap should never, ever get saved
9131 fake_map::fake_map( const ter_id &ter_type )
9132 {
9133  const tripoint_abs_sm tripoint_below_zero( 0, 0, fake_map_z );
9134 
9135  set_abs_sub( tripoint_below_zero );
9136  for( int gridx = 0; gridx < get_my_MAPSIZE(); gridx++ ) {
9137  for( int gridy = 0; gridy < get_my_MAPSIZE(); gridy++ ) {
9138  std::unique_ptr<submap> sm = std::make_unique<submap>();
9139 
9140  sm->set_all_ter( ter_type );
9141  sm->set_all_furn( furn_str_id::NULL_ID() );
9142  sm->set_all_traps( tr_null );
9143 
9144  setsubmap( get_nonant( { gridx, gridy, fake_map_z } ), sm.get() );
9145 
9146  temp_submaps_.emplace_back( std::move( sm ) );
9147  }
9148  }
9149 }
9150 
9151 fake_map::~fake_map() = default;
9152 
9153 void map::set_graffiti( const tripoint &p, const std::string &contents )
9154 {
9155  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
9156  return;
9157  }
9158  point l;
9159  submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
9160  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
9161  debugmsg( "Tried to set graffiti at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
9162  return;
9163  }
9164  current_submap->set_graffiti( l, contents );
9165 }
9166 
9167 void map::delete_graffiti( const tripoint &p )
9168 {
9169  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
9170  return;
9171  }
9172  point l;
9173  submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
9174  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
9175  debugmsg( "Tried to delete graffiti at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
9176  return;
9177  }
9178  current_submap->delete_graffiti( l );
9179 }
9180 
9181 const std::string &map::graffiti_at( const tripoint &p ) const
9182 {
9183  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
9184  static const std::string empty_string;
9185  return empty_string;
9186  }
9187  point l;
9188  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
9189  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
9190  debugmsg( "Tried to get graffiti at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
9191  static const std::string empty_string;
9192  return empty_string;
9193  }
9194  return current_submap->get_graffiti( l );
9195 }
9196 
9197 bool map::has_graffiti_at( const tripoint &p ) const
9198 {
9199  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
9200  return false;
9201  }
9202  point l;
9203  const submap *const current_submap = unsafe_get_submap_at( p, l );
9204  if( current_submap == nullptr ) {
9205  debugmsg( "Tried to get graffiti at (%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", l.x, l.y );
9206  return false;
9207  }
9208  return current_submap->has_graffiti( l );
9209 }
9210 
9211 int map::determine_wall_corner( const tripoint &p ) const
9212 {
9213  const std::bitset<NUM_TERCONN> &test_connect_group = ter( p ).obj().connect_to_groups;
9214  uint8_t connections = get_known_connections( p, test_connect_group );
9215  // The bits in connections are SEWN, whereas the characters in LINE_
9216  // constants are NESW, so we want values in 8 | 2 | 1 | 4 order.
9217  switch( connections ) {
9218  case 8 | 2 | 1 | 4:
9219  return LINE_XXXX;
9220  case 0 | 2 | 1 | 4:
9221  return LINE_OXXX;
9222 
9223  case 8 | 0 | 1 | 4:
9224  return LINE_XOXX;
9225  case 0 | 0 | 1 | 4:
9226  return LINE_OOXX;
9227 
9228  case 8 | 2 | 0 | 4:
9229  return LINE_XXOX;
9230  case 0 | 2 | 0 | 4: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9231  return LINE_OXOX;
9232  case 8 | 0 | 0 | 4: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9233  return LINE_XOOX;
9234  case 0 | 0 | 0 | 4:
9235  return LINE_OXOX; // LINE_OOOX would be better
9236 
9237  case 8 | 2 | 1 | 0:
9238  return LINE_XXXO;
9239  case 0 | 2 | 1 | 0: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9240  return LINE_OXXO;
9241  case 8 | 0 | 1 | 0: // NOLINT(bugprone-branch-clone,misc-redundant-expression)
9242  return LINE_XOXO;
9243  case 0 | 0 | 1 | 0:
9244  return LINE_XOXO; // LINE_OOXO would be better
9245  case 8 | 2 | 0 | 0: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9246  return LINE_XXOO;
9247  case 0 | 2 | 0 | 0: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9248  return LINE_OXOX; // LINE_OXOO would be better
9249  case 8 | 0 | 0 | 0: // NOLINT(misc-redundant-expression)
9250  return LINE_XOXO; // LINE_XOOO would be better
9251 
9252  case 0 | 0 | 0 | 0:
9253  return ter( p ).obj().symbol(); // technically just a column
9254 
9255  default:
9256  // cata_assert( false );
9257  // this shall not happen
9258  return '?';
9259  }
9260 }
9261 
9262 void map::build_outside_cache( const int zlev )
9263 {
9264  auto *ch_lazy = get_cache_lazy( zlev );
9265  if( !ch_lazy || !ch_lazy->outside_cache_dirty ) {
9266  return;
9267  }
9268  level_cache &ch = *ch_lazy;
9269 
9270  // Make a bigger cache to avoid bounds checking
9271  // We will later copy it to our regular cache
9272  const size_t padded_w = MAPSIZE_X + 2;
9273  const size_t padded_h = MAPSIZE_Y + 2;
9274  cata::mdarray<bool, point_bub_ms, padded_w, padded_h> padded_cache;
9275 
9276  auto &outside_cache = ch.outside_cache;
9277  if( zlev < 0 ) {
9278  std::uninitialized_fill_n(
9279  &outside_cache[0][0], MAPSIZE_X * MAPSIZE_Y, false );
9280  return;
9281  }
9282 
9283  padded_cache.fill( true );
9284 
9285  for( int smx = 0; smx < my_MAPSIZE; ++smx ) {
9286  for( int smy = 0; smy < my_MAPSIZE; ++smy ) {
9287  const submap *cur_submap = get_submap_at_grid( { smx, smy, zlev } );
9288  if( cur_submap == nullptr ) {
9289  debugmsg( "Tried to build outside cache at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", smx, smy,
9290  zlev );
9291  continue;
9292  }
9293 
9294  for( int sx = 0; sx < SEEX; ++sx ) {
9295  for( int sy = 0; sy < SEEY; ++sy ) {
9296  point sp( sx, sy );
9297  if( cur_submap->get_ter( sp ).obj().has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS ) ||
9298  cur_submap->get_furn( sp ).obj().has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_INDOORS ) ) {
9299  const point p( sx + smx * SEEX, sy + smy * SEEY );
9300  // Add 1 to both coordinates, because we're operating on the padded cache
9301  for( int dx = 0; dx <= 2; dx++ ) {
9302  for( int dy = 0; dy <= 2; dy++ ) {
9303  padded_cache[p.x + dx][p.y + dy] = false;
9304  }
9305  }
9306  }
9307  }
9308  }
9309  }
9310  }
9311 
9312  // Copy the padded cache back to the proper one, but with no padding
9313  for( int x = 0; x < SEEX * my_MAPSIZE; x++ ) {
9314  std::copy_n( &padded_cache[x + 1][1], SEEX * my_MAPSIZE, &outside_cache[x][0] );
9315  }
9316 
9317  ch.outside_cache_dirty = false;
9318 }
9319 
9320 void map::build_obstacle_cache(
9321  const tripoint &start, const tripoint &end,
9322  cata::mdarray<fragment_cloud, point_bub_ms> &obstacle_cache )
9323 {
9324  const point min_submap{ std::max( 0, start.x / SEEX ), std::max( 0, start.y / SEEY ) };
9325  const point max_submap{
9326  std::min( my_MAPSIZE - 1, end.x / SEEX ), std::min( my_MAPSIZE - 1, end.y / SEEY ) };
9327  // Find and cache all the map obstacles.
9328  // For now setting obstacles to be extremely dense and fill their squares.
9329  // In future, scale effective obstacle density by the thickness of the obstacle.
9330  // Also consider modelling partial obstacles.
9331  // TODO: Support z-levels.
9332  for( int smx = min_submap.x; smx <= max_submap.x; ++smx ) {
9333  for( int smy = min_submap.y; smy <= max_submap.y; ++smy ) {
9334  const submap *cur_submap = get_submap_at_grid( { smx, smy, start.z } );
9335  if( cur_submap == nullptr ) {
9336  debugmsg( "Tried to build obstacle cache at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", smx, smy,
9337  start.z );
9338  continue;
9339  }
9340 
9341  // TODO: Init indices to prevent iterating over unused submap sections.
9342  for( int sx = 0; sx < SEEX; ++sx ) {
9343  for( int sy = 0; sy < SEEY; ++sy ) {
9344  const point sp( sx, sy );
9345  int ter_move = cur_submap->get_ter( sp ).obj().movecost;
9346  int furn_move = cur_submap->get_furn( sp ).obj().movecost;
9347  const point p2( sx + smx * SEEX, sy + smy * SEEY );
9348  if( ter_move == 0 || furn_move < 0 || ter_move + furn_move == 0 ) {
9349  obstacle_cache[p2.x][p2.y].velocity = 1000.0f;
9350  obstacle_cache[p2.x][p2.y].density = 0.0f;
9351  } else {
9352  // Magic number warning, this is the density of air at sea level at
9353  // some nominal temp and humidity.
9354  // TODO: figure out if our temp/altitude/humidity variation is
9355  // sufficient to bother setting this differently.
9356  obstacle_cache[p2.x][p2.y].velocity = 1.2f;
9357  obstacle_cache[p2.x][p2.y].density = 1.0f;
9358  }
9359  }
9360  }
9361  }
9362  }
9363  VehicleList vehs = get_vehicles( start, end );
9364  const inclusive_cuboid<tripoint> bounds( start, end );
9365  // Cache all the vehicle stuff in one loop
9366  for( wrapped_vehicle &v : vehs ) {
9367  for( const vpart_reference &vp : v.v->get_all_parts() ) {
9368  tripoint p = v.pos + vp.part().precalc[0];
9369  if( p.z != start.z ) {
9370  break;
9371  }
9372  if( !bounds.contains( p ) ) {
9373  continue;
9374  }
9375 
9376  if( vp.obstacle_at_part() ) {
9377  obstacle_cache[p.x][p.y].velocity = 1000.0f;
9378  obstacle_cache[p.x][p.y].density = 0.0f;
9379  }
9380  }
9381  }
9382  // Iterate over creatures and set them to block their squares relative to their size.
9383  for( Creature &critter : g->all_creatures() ) {
9384  const tripoint loc = critter.pos();
9385  if( loc.z != start.z ) {
9386  continue;
9387  }
9388  // TODO: scale this with expected creature "thickness".
9389  obstacle_cache[loc.x][loc.y].velocity = 1.2f;
9390  // ranged_target_size is "proportion of square that is blocked", and density needs to be
9391  // "transmissivity of square", so we need the reciprocal.
9392  obstacle_cache[loc.x][loc.y].density = 1.0 - critter.ranged_target_size();
9393  }
9394 }
9395 
9396 // If this ever shows up on profiling, maybe prepopulate one of these in the map cache for each level.
9397 std::bitset<OVERMAP_LAYERS> map::get_inter_level_visibility( const int origin_zlevel ) const
9398 {
9399  std::bitset<OVERMAP_LAYERS> seen_levels;
9400  seen_levels.set( origin_zlevel + OVERMAP_DEPTH );
9401  for( int z = origin_zlevel + 1; z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT; ++z ) {
9402  if( get_cache_ref( z ).no_floor_gaps ) {
9403  break;
9404  } else {
9405  seen_levels.set( z + OVERMAP_DEPTH );
9406  }
9407  }
9408  for( int z = origin_zlevel; z > -OVERMAP_DEPTH; --z ) {
9409  if( get_cache_ref( z ).no_floor_gaps ) {
9410  break;
9411  } else {
9412  // No floor means we can see the *lower* level.
9413  seen_levels.set( z - 1 + OVERMAP_DEPTH );
9414  }
9415  }
9416  return seen_levels;
9417 }
9418 
9419 bool map::build_floor_cache( const int zlev )
9420 {
9421  auto *ch_lazy = get_cache_lazy( zlev );
9422  if( !ch_lazy || !ch_lazy->floor_cache_dirty ) {
9423  return false;
9424  }
9425  level_cache &ch = *ch_lazy;
9426 
9427  auto &floor_cache = ch.floor_cache;
9428  std::uninitialized_fill_n(
9429  &floor_cache[0][0], MAPSIZE_X * MAPSIZE_Y, true );
9430  bool &no_floor_gaps = ch.no_floor_gaps;
9431  no_floor_gaps = true;
9432 
9433  bool lowest_z_lev = zlev <= -OVERMAP_DEPTH;
9434 
9435  for( int smx = 0; smx < my_MAPSIZE; ++smx ) {
9436  for( int smy = 0; smy < my_MAPSIZE; ++smy ) {
9437  const submap *cur_submap = get_submap_at_grid( { smx, smy, zlev } );
9438  const submap *below_submap = !lowest_z_lev ? get_submap_at_grid( { smx, smy, zlev - 1 } ) : nullptr;
9439 
9440  if( cur_submap == nullptr ) {
9441  debugmsg( "Tried to build floor cache at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", smx, smy, zlev );
9442  continue;
9443  }
9444  if( !lowest_z_lev && below_submap == nullptr ) {
9445  debugmsg( "Tried to build floor cache at (%d,%d,%d) but the submap is not loaded", smx, smy,
9446  zlev - 1 );
9447  continue;
9448  }
9449 
9450  for( int sx = 0; sx < SEEX; ++sx ) {
9451  for( int sy = 0; sy < SEEY; ++sy ) {
9452  point sp( sx, sy );
9453  const ter_t &terrain = cur_submap->get_ter( sp ).obj();
